commit_message:
set default auth_strategy to keystone

Like in change Ife63dc7ab680fcf0588d95c98fc9f29901485c64 for Nova
the default for auth_strategy should be keystone instead of noauth.

DocImpact Changed default config option 'auth_strategy' to 'keystone'.

Change-Id: I112e26446b2c62abd633ee68ae7d9b24925e9936
Closes-Bug: #1327503

commit_message:
Add volume driver for Huawei 18000 storage system

Huawei OceanStor 18000-series enterprise storage system is an optimum
storage platform for next-generation data centers that feature
virtualization, hybrid cloud, simplified IT, and low carbon footprints.

This patch add an iSCSI driver and a FC driver for Huawei 18000 storage
system, using REST. We define a common module for both iSCSI driver and
FC driver.

Change-Id: I0325aac53f6eb2691ed6057f81d6aeb8c794c789
Implements: blueprint huawei-18000-driver

commit_message:
Fix missing clone_image API support for sheepdog driver.

if image is backend by sheepdog, it will use create_cloned_volume
function to help to clone this image. Normally sheepdog can clone
only from snapshot.

Closes-Bug: #1140177
Change-Id: Ibd355082e7c3215c00f6576404566577f7a2601c

commit_message:
Add a method _get_ssl_config to save the ssl configurations

When the SSL configurations have been read once, save them into ssl_kwargs
for further use.

Change-Id: I6fe02251b60a873a644f0fcdbba9ea6cac657919
closes-bug: #1301448

commit_message:
Allow a volume to be rolled back to its snapshot

It makes sense to be able to revert a volume to a previously
taken snapshot. The roll-back function can be used to revert
 a volume to a previous snapshot, restoring the volume to
 the state at the time the snapshot was taken. The function
supports roll-back to any previously taken snapshot on the
volume (we will call it the roll-back snapshot in this
document to distinguish it from other snapshots).

The roll-back process will overwrite the existing volume with
data from the rollback snapshot; all other snapshots taken
after the rollback snapshot will be deleted.

Note
The volume that for the roll-back must be detached if it is
attached to a Nova VM.

Change-Id: If8e22ba4762a97d324afdcbde0b8731a3d7d898c
Implements: blueprint cinder-volume-rollback-snapshot

commit_message:
Implement zfs driver.

blueprint zfs-based-iscsi-san
blueprint zfsonlinux-volume-driver

This driver has been tested on Linux and FreeBSD. It includes a
snapshot-based image-cache.

Change-Id: Ieef1a58b78bba75147fcfb0d406abaa4a3fdf711

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-05-23 19:21:31.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/drivers/netapp/nfs.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/netapp/iscsi.py'], 'message': 'Set the NetApp iSCSI and NFS server ports as configured

The NetAppDirectISCSIDriver and NetAppNFSDriver drivers do not set the
netapp_server_port value configured in cinder.conf and only selects a port
based on the transport type (http or https).

This work-around makes netapp_server_port a required configuration
as it overwrites the default port settings implemented in

Closes-Bug: #1322379
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Set the NetApp iSCSI and NFS server ports as configured

The NetAppDirectISCSIDriver and NetAppNFSDriver drivers do not set the
netapp_server_port value configured in cinder.conf and only selects a port
based on the transport type (http or https).

This work-around makes netapp_server_port a required configuration
as it overwrites the default port settings implemented in
cinder/volume/drivers/netapp/api.py NaServer.set_transport_type()
and setting netapp_transport_type to https will still use the default
netapp_server_port of 80.

Change-Id: Iee22ef7146adb0f0e6ee8fdd72ec4713a564415b
Closes-Bug: #1322379

commit_message:
Fixes cinder quota-defaults information with wrong tenant-id

quota-defaults displays the default information even though specified
tenant-id does not exist.

  cinder quota-defaults wrong_tenant_id

The fix has been applied so that quota-defaults with wrong tenant-id will
display an error with "TenantID not found"

Change-Id: I425112f1bb79bab337e8c3d84214d3dff6756956
Closes-Bug: #1307486

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-07-28 20:09:46.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Move CA cert property out of "stunnel" and into a new "ssl" group"

The CA certificate is currently passed via ssl-source.yaml as
"stunnel.cacert", but this value really has nothing to do with stunnel.

This change proposes that it be exposed as "ssl.ca_certificate",
which is consistent with the overall SSL direction being driven by
os-cloud-config:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/103637/9/os_cloud_config/ssl_pki.py

Because no DIB elements currently rely on this value, the change
should is safe, with no backward compatibility issues.

commit_message:
Move cacert property out of "stunnel" and into a new "ssl" group

The CA certificate is currently passed via ssl-source.yaml as
"stunnel.cacert", but this value is not currently used by stunnel
since we have no use case for client cert authentication.

This change proposes that it also be exposed as
"ssl.ca_certificate", which is consistent with the overall SSL
direction being driven by the PKI spec:
  I32473fe797a4c1e28d14c3b82c8892c7c59a4e55

This new CA certificate value will be installed as a trusted CA
on all cloud nodes that issue SSL-secured connection requests to
OpenStack or other infrastructure (MySQL, RabbitMQ) services.

Change-Id: Ibacd7c98980520e11c0df89632013f2ba2dbe370

commit_message:
Fixes cinder quota-update with wrong tenant-id

quota-update returns 200 (OK) even though specified tenant-id
does not exist.

  cinder quota-update wrong-tenant --gigabytes 2

The fix has been applied so that quota-update with wrong tenant-id will
display an error with "TenantID not found"

Change-Id: I892267f9f551d3436faf90a612ac45b04b64c421
Closes-Bug: #1307491

commit_message:
Do not use __builtin__ in python3

__builtin__ does not exist in Python 3, use
six.moves.builtins instead.

Change-Id: I6fbed58f266281f0756b2988d7db08e2792113f3
closes-bug: #1290234

commit_message:
Use proper exception module

In iscsi, c.brick.exception is imported, but it is only used to
guard database access. Database will never throw
c.brick.exception.NotFound, instead it raises c.exception.NotFound.

This is only half a fix: the true culprit is the confusing duplication
besteen c.exception and c.brick.exception.

Change-Id: I5d345f6f33167bd8be0041860751bdd90361dcf5

commit_message:
Support new format in policy.json in cinder

Merged in the openstack-common policy codes from nova to keep the new
format in policy.json in cinder supported in the same way with that in
nova and other components. The cinder-specific policy and test bits are
also updated for the new format. The policy.json is just changed in the
format.

Change-Id: I92ccab9d8773affacd61c106fdefc1c5dc61bd07
Partial-Bug: #1279263

According to https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Python3 iterator.next()
should be replaced with next(iterator).

commit_message:
Import fixes from the Nova driver reviews

Import fixes from the Nova driver review, based upon revision 4
of https://review.openstack.org/#/c/111423/

- Add unittests for patcher.create()
- Convert some of the tests for the PXEDriverFields to GenericDriverFields
  and make sure that the delta from the PXE class is covered

Change-Id: Iec8d1d379458b89a2140dc473ad691dc5dd6d3dc

subject: Proof-of-concept cinder driver for DRBDmanage.
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1207, 'name': 'Duncan Thomas', 'email': 'duncan.thomas@gmail.com', 'username': 'duncan-thomas'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2014-06-10 09:29:11.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/drivers/drbdmanagedrv.py', 'requirements.txt', 'README.DRBDmanage+Cinder.txt'], 'message': 'Proof-of-concept cinder driver for DRBDmanage.

DRBDmanage is a utility for simplified and automated administration
of resources on a multiple-node DRBD 9 cluster.

This POC (currently) only allows create/delete of volumes,
and copying images into them; the next step is snapshot
functionality, so that the Minimum Feature list is available.

Change-Id: I4b4b859d1abf16098ef51db6afe2bf01255c337b
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Proof-of-concept cinder driver for DRBDmanage.

DRBDmanage is a utility for simplified and automated administration
of resources on a multiple-node DRBD 9 cluster.

This POC (currently) only allows create/delete of volumes,
and copying images into them; the next step is snapshot
functionality, so that the Minimum Feature list is available.

Change-Id: I4b4b859d1abf16098ef51db6afe2bf01255c337b

commit_message:
Set useful vendor/product id in tgt ISCSI exports

This can be very useful for debugging and can be used
to filter out access from tenant volumes within compute
hosts.

Closes-Bug: #1261796

commit_message:
Add create qcow2 support in generic nfs driver

Add a bool "nfs_qcow2_volumes" config to cinder.conf, with it set
to True and "nfs_sparsed_volumes" set to False, volumes will be
created as QCOW2 file rather than regular raw or sparse file.

implements: blueprint qcow2-on-generic-nfs-driver
Change-Id: Ic849babcc78fbe786cb9fc9ab03661c8d9fd4e97

Fix neutron/nova datasource tests to inherit from base.TestCase

Previously this needs to be done so that cfg is setup which is
done in this base class.

commit_message:
Fix markup of section_compute-cells.xml

The markup in the variablelist was inconsistent, some <term> used
<option>, others not. Use <term><option> everywhere.

commit_message:
Code change for nova support cinder client v2

Use v2 volume endpoint to attach/detach volume would be failed,
due to nova not supporting cinder client v2 yet. This patch is for
nova support cinder client v2.

Implements bp support-cinderclient-v2
Closes-Bug: #1215772
Co-Authored-By: Mike Perez <thingee@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: Yaguang Tang <yaguang.tang@canonical.com>

Change-Id: Id8abbbb4d9b0c8c49ab51fc3d958ef0d487467f8

subject: 5.0 Fix for SSH method of OSTF tests
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 8789, 'name': 'Dmitry Pyzhov', 'email': 'dpyzhov+gerrit@mirantis.com', 'username': 'dpyzhov'}, {'_account_id': 8882, 'name': 'Nastya Urlapova', 'email': 'aurlapova@mirantis.com', 'username': 'NastyaUrlapova'}, {'_account_id': 8971, 'name': 'Fuel CI', 'username': 'fuel-ci', 'inactive': True, 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2014-08-12 10:48:16.000000000', 'files': ['fuel_health/nmanager.py'], 'message': '5.0 Fix for SSH method of OSTF tests

In SSH method of OSTF tests address of controller node is chosen
as the first from list of controller nodes.
It may not work when we have a few controller nodes (HA mode) and one
of controller nodes went away. Now controller node is chosen
from list of controller nodes online.

Change-Id: I7f9eedfc797689e609680016a7085fdf30af24e7
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
5.0 Fix for SSH method of OSTF tests

In SSH method of OSTF tests address of controller node is chosen
as the first from list of controller nodes.
It may not work when we have a few controller nodes (HA mode) and one
of controller nodes went away. Now controller node is chosen
from list of controller nodes online.

Change-Id: I7f9eedfc797689e609680016a7085fdf30af24e7

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-06-13 22:21:10.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "WIP: Add min_client_version decorator for CLI tests

This adds the min_client_version decorator to be used in the CLI tests.
The decorator is used skip CLI tests where the command being tested
isn't available in the version of the client we're testing against.

The cmd method is moved out of the ClientTestBase class so it can be
used by the decorator.

To start using the decorator and show how it works, two known CLI tests
are decorated for minimum version checks on their clients.

TODO(mriedem): some simple unit tests

Part of blueprint minversion-check-for-cli-tests

Change-Id: I8a0ee390048870d450772fa064d0dc2daa2b7036

commit_message:
Add min_client_version decorator for CLI tests

This adds the min_client_version decorator to be used in the CLI tests.
The decorator is used skip CLI tests where the command being tested
isn't available in the version of the client we're testing against.

The cmd method is pulled out of the ClientTestBase class so it can be
used by the decorator and is renamed so it does not conflict with the
cmd argument passed to it.

To start using the decorator and show how it works, two known CLI tests
are decorated for minimum version checks on their clients.

Part of blueprint minversion-check-for-cli-tests

Change-Id: I8a0ee390048870d450772fa064d0dc2daa2b7036

commit_message:
Migrate security notes to new repository

The security notes have been migrated to the central security-doc
repository.  This patch cleans out the old contents to prevent
accidental use of this repository for creation of new notes.  This
is a temporary measure until we delete this repository sometime in
the near future.  A pointer to the new repository location has been
added in a README file.

Change-Id: I35b7b0c9c03ba8f416e58d26b9213f9e038357b2

commit_message:
Convert network/api.py uses of vif database functions to objects

This makes network/api.py use the VirtualInterface object instead of direct
database queries. This is the last direct/obvious use of nova.db.* in the
network api.

Related to blueprint compute-manager-objects-juno

Change-Id: Ia3eb1694f3708aeceb4c77876a210a7cb6532be1

commit_message:
Add notifications for identity authenticate events

This patch adds support for notifications for when a user authenticates.
For more information on what events keystone supports visit:

http://docs.openstack.org/developer/keystone/event_notifications.html#auditing-with-cadf

Change-Id: I73c6971902750b401a29bb21d41617b9775946a0

converts it to use the Instance object.

commit_message:
Add sync_ceph_time method to all Ceph tests

Sometimes after reverting snapshots Ceph health check
alerts about clock skew on some nodes, so an additional
time sync and ceph service restart were added to the
test. Also, refactored methods which are used for ceph
checks.

Change-Id: I6c875f19cd3802e8280de48d121b7900b25a0f3a
Closes-bug: #1349379

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-06-20 21:28:08.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Add username to global tenant stack list

This adds the stack username to each stack in the output of a stack list
when the global_tenant flag is set to true.

Co-Authored-By: Anderson Mesquita <andersonvom@gmail.com>
Implements: blueprint global-tenant-username
Change-Id: Ia1386531025096e0eeaf9e98b478c4453fc8cb01
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2014-07-15 14:47:06.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Display stack owner when formatting stacks

Stacks are launched by users but scoped to tenants, so users in the same
tenant currently have no way to know owns each stack.  The same is
especially true to unscoped stack lists.  Since humans are much better
with names than they are with numbers, this adds the stack owner
username to the data returned with each stack.

Co-Authored-By: Anderson Mesquita <andersonvom@gmail.com>
Implements: blueprint stack-display-fields
Change-Id: Ia1386531025096e0eeaf9e98b478c4453fc8cb01

commit_message:
Display stack owner when formatting stacks

Stacks are launched by users but scoped to tenants, so users in the same
tenant currently have no way to know owns each stack.  The same is
especially true to unscoped stack lists.  Since humans are much better
with names than they are with numbers, this adds the stack owner
username to the data returned with each stack.

Co-Authored-By: Anderson Mesquita <andersonvom@gmail.com>
Implements: blueprint stack-display-fields
Change-Id: Ia1386531025096e0eeaf9e98b478c4453fc8cb01

commit_message:
Fix scss directory imports

If we attempt to import a file with the same name as a directory scss
gets confused and explodes. Make these names unambigious.

Closes-Bug: #1349774

Change-Id: I2d7d384b7ce2d2e073161e17dc10a2653e6ca10e

commit_message:
Add flavors support to mongodb

This patch is a follow-up on the queue's flavor work. It adds support
for such feature to the MongoDB storage driver.

Partially-Implements blueprint: marconi-queue-flavors

Change-Id: Ib3231ab361896e1c08831d17899dd4111710ab9b

commit_message:
Reorganize docs folder

For now, developers guide will be living in doc/source
(this is where all OpenStack projects store their developers docs)
and the user guide will be store in doc/user-guide

commit_message:
Migrate OSSNs to the security-doc repo

The OpenStack Security Notes are being migrated to the new
security-doc repository that we use for the security guide.  This
patch migrates over the existing content of the old OSSN repository
without any modification to content.

Change-Id: I348d0591fc71c1174368fad7ef761e489c88ab9c

[{'created': '2014-07-28 15:22:28.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Debug log messages need to be unicode

Makes all strings being used with LOG.debug into unicode strings.

Not using unicode causes failures when replacement text is unicode.

For example, when replacement text is an exception, if the exception
message is unicode (due to translation) it will fail.  When lazy
translation is enabled for blueprint: i18n-enablement the message
is replaced with an object that does not support str() and it will
always fail.

commit_message:
Debug log messages need to be unicode

Makes all strings being used with LOG.debug into unicode strings.

Not using unicode causes failures when replacement text is unicode.

For example, when replacement text is an exception, if the exception
message is unicode (due to translation) it will fail.  When lazy
translation is enabled for blueprint: i18n-enablement the message
is replaced with an object that does not support str() and it will
always fail.

This includes a hacking check to ensure this requirement is followed.

Change-Id: I0ed4569269c2e3e32c3e53bf9efa2f107ca305c4
Closes-bug: #1348244

commit_message:
Replace assertTrue with assertIsNotNone for check an object

assertTrue(*) means to check whether a boolean value/expression
is true or not. For checking an object is not None, we should use
assertIsNotNone(*), which gives more explicit expression.

Change-Id: Ia4d0dcec81e97fe4774bff4e41a017f00b899ef3
Closes-Bug: #1297156

[{'created': '2014-07-11 08:23:38.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Set page size when Glance API request is called

Central Agent (actually plugins defined in ceilometer/image/glance.py) uses
glanceclient to get image-list from glance.
Since glanceclient has pagenation feature, it calls glance API for every
page sizes. When glanceclient is used by Cetral Agent, default value of page
size, that is 20, is used, since Central Agent doesn't specify page size.
However, default value of page size is too small when there is a large
number of images.

Therefore we need to specify page size from Central Agent.

Closes-bug: #1340577

commit_message:
Set page size when Glance API request is called

The glance related pollsters in central agent uses glanceclient to get
image-list from glance. Since glanceclient has pagination feature,
it calls glance API for every page sizes. When glanceclient is used by
Central Agent, default value of page size, that is 20, is used, since
Central Agent doesn't specify page size. However, default value of page
size is too small when there is a large number of images.

Therefore we need to specify page size from Central Agent.

Change-Id: I5f6457234a2963bbe567d078f2c8bb098c8a311c
Closes-bug: #1340577

commit_message:
Show port by MAC address

Expose a mean to search for a port by a given MAC address. e.g

$ ironic port-show --address aa:bb:cc:dd:ee:ff

Closes-Bug: #1355155
Change-Id: Ie069bdebfe5143fdcba62a6390729934a4b44f5a

commit_message:
Make the tripleorc file set -u safe

We have had reports that when tripleorc is sourced by scripts which are
set -u (such as the "Devtest cloud initialization script" created by
Tuskar), execution is aborted because $ELEMENT_PATH is referenced before
it is set.

This change makes the first reference to $ELEMENT_PATH set -u safe - if
it's not set an empty string will be returned and the next line of code
will set it.

Change-Id: I0329fd4bdb6b5e360cf2464def6bace655827944
Closes-Bug: #1335105

commit_message:
Remove magic() method from context manager

This magic methods brings a lot of issues:
*) Unclear code

*) Recursion and with construction that makes it hard
to understand traces & as well to have a proper workflow

*) Uncontrollable process of creation and deletion of context:
E.g. it's super hard to "abort" creation of context in the middle

*) create() & cleanup() are inseparable => which makes it impossible
to create "persistance context", that have to run separately
setup() & cleanup()

Change-Id: I071c53900441121767ac3550c5ee5790a358ae73

commit_message:
Fixes an issue with FIP re-association

When the last FIP is disassociated, the namespace and
interfaces should be removed. The internal interface
wasn't removed before without problems, but now the
namespace cannot be removed with that interface present.
The fix is to remove the internal FIP interface before
removing the namespace.

Change-Id: I021c658ecde584821f67b7a8de0205e8e938bb2d
Closes-bug: 1353287

commit_message:
Don't allow swift-recon cron job to send mail

The cron job is periodically sending out emails. They are going
to root's mailbox and would likely be left unread.

swift-recon-cron logs its activities so the emails are not
needed.

Change-Id: Idf66b59b883e13b2f4aa4fcfd575adc89e770d98
Closes-Bug: 1354262

commit_message:
V3 Extension class

There was no base class specific to V3 extensions. This adds a base
class for V3 extensions and also changes the current V3 extensions
to use it.

bp json-home

Change-Id: I9a65867ced1bc116e3395baf4abfa35796511788

commit_message:
Fix /etc/nova permissions

nova-api does not start when SELinux is in enforcing mode.
A dac_override error is logged. Changing the permissions to
root.nova fixes the issue.

Bug: 1344452
Change-Id: I023c6394a6e4d9c8ee661a8403171b4975124943

commit_message:
use os-svc-enable to enable openvswitch

Unkike RHEL/Fedora, Debian/Ubuntu OVS package is called
openvswitch-switch. os-svc-enable can use map-services to
deal with the problem.

This change requires patch I2748a9db7f8ee456698187a9646bc7cda2256fe7.

Change-Id: I6e3df30dc3a6918f3a949a7dac47289ede5c3d1f

commit_message:
Revert "Fix argparse issue for RHEL 6.5."

This reverts commit d088fde2ea59423d153f32d65be684be62727232.

Since the underlying problem with argparse has been resolved 
in python 2.7 and filtering out argparse for python 2.6 has been removed,
there is no longer a need to explicitly install argparse for python 2.6.

Closes-bug: #1346364
Change-Id: If9534bf5a4400f5f72475c67a8e6e14da08f9562

commit_message:
Allow software config at deploy

Adds a method to Instance to allow subclasses to perform additional
updates to heat templates; subclasses should take care to expose
as little or as much as makes sense regarding implementation details.
Additions are added after the Instance Heat fragments are added but
before the stack is pushed.

Also adds a function to HeatSWConfigInstance to add SoftwareConfig
(and StructuredConfig) elements and their Deployments.

Change-Id: I1cd127a32e3115765f8a26886eeeeb5696f686fd
Implements: blueprint software-config-at-deploy-time

commit_message:
makes sure correct PCI device allocation

With this patch, on the compute node, a stats pool will be associated with a
list of devices that belongs to the pool. This makes sure that PCI devices are
allocated out of the same stats pools that are used by the nova scheduler to
satisfy the PCI requests. And therefore, stats pools on the compute nodes will
be kept in sync with their counterparts in the nova scheduler.

Change-Id: I2d97c6354215e2ac5ff659e3203c33771abe1c09
Closes-bug: #1288809

commit_message:
Modify symbolic link creation.

Add a guard so that if /var/log/httpd exist that file is not created
in the /var/log/apache2 directory linking to itself. Also make the
symbolic link creation treat LINK_NAME as a normal file if it is a
symbolic link to a directory. Additionally add a check that if
another element (such as Idced49d2ada450d7948036a9f475c33e29d65712)
has created /var/log/httpd it is not recreated.

Change-Id: I3c08c54c02f2737ee00ac25e34953aa7b3ab546f

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-04-24 12:19:48.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Account cache does not cleaned for container operations

Here is some test I performed:
1. On new account I set max_container_per_account = 5
2. I run a loop of 10 REST requests to create random containers.

Surprisingly I managed to create 9 of them.

I then noticed strange behaviour of ContainerController
of proxy/controllers. PUT, POST, DELETE operations are all
contains calls to clear cache, but all of them clears only
container cache and not the account cache.
I assume this is wrong behaviour, since account cache
contains wrong information about it's containers ( untill
cache is refreshed, of course). In particular "container_count"
of account cache is wrong, untill refreshed.

To resolve this, I added a call to clear account cache.

Change-Id: I199a98e3584eab4c768b57a523c15c9026a748cf

commit_message:
Account cache does not cleaned for container operations

Here is some test I performed:
1. On new account I set max_container_per_account = 5
2. I run a loop of 10 REST requests to create random containers.

Surprisingly I managed to create 9 of them.

I then noticed strange behaviour of ContainerController
of proxy/controllers. PUT, POST, DELETE operations are all
contains calls to clear cache, but all of them clears only
container cache and not the account cache.
I assume this is wrong behaviour, since account cache
contains wrong information about it's containers ( untill
cache is refreshed, of course). In particular "container_count"
of account cache is wrong, untill refreshed.

To resolve this, I added a call to clear account cache.

Change-Id: I199a98e3584eab4c768b57a523c15c9026a748cf

commit_message:
Make compound sorting more obvious

Tablesorter plugin allows user to compound sort when they hold down the
SHIFT key. However, this is not an obvious feature and not documented
anywhere.

Change-Id: I8ed9633f1a2f06a8815c057c737eb76dd19ed94f
Closes-Bug: #1287418

commit_message:
Fix flavor detail popover

The data in the popover tooltip is showing raw HTML. This patch fixes this
issue so that it looks properly. Also reformatted the template a bit.

Change-Id: I9e355f60e9373aff99df831b9f73b36d97e5972d
Closes-Bug: #1349614

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 114, 'name': 'Victor Lowther', 'email': 'victor.lowther@gmail.com', 'username': 'victor-lowther'}, {'_account_id': 6796, 'name': 'Giulio Fidente', 'email': 'gfidente@redhat.com', 'username': 'gfidente'}, {'_account_id': 6928, 'name': 'Ben Nemec', 'email': 'openstack@nemebean.com', 'username': 'bnemec'}, {'_account_id': 7144, 'name': 'James Slagle', 'email': 'jslagle@redhat.com', 'username': 'slagle'}, {'_account_id': 7471, 'name': 'Richard Su', 'email': 'rwsu@redhat.com', 'username': 'rwsu'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2014-07-21 13:54:42.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Get selinux enforcing status straight from the kernel.

Instead of relying on parsing config files to see if selinux is
available, enabled, and enforcing, check the kernel directly.  This
allows 11-selinux-fixfiles-restore to operate correctly in situations
where the userspace config is not in sync with the kernel, such as
when running inside a Docker container.

Change-Id: I0bec885d6e5d4f4e1106f3bd2a90ba5f86395b07
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2014-08-05 01:04:46.000000000', 'files': ['elements/rpm-distro/finalise.d/11-selinux-fixfiles-restore'], 'message': 'Relabel filesystem if SELinux is available

Relabel the filesystem during image builds if SELinux is supported
in the kernel of the build machine and userspace tools are available.

Otherwise touch /.autorelabel to schedule a relabel the first time
the image boots. We relabel when possible because it decreases first
boot time.

Change-Id: I0bec885d6e5d4f4e1106f3bd2a90ba5f86395b07
Partial-Bug: 1347845
', 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
Relabel filesystem if SELinux is available

Relabel the filesystem during image builds if SELinux is supported
in the kernel of the build machine and userspace tools are available.

Otherwise touch /.autorelabel to schedule a relabel the first time
the image boots. We relabel when possible because it decreases first
boot time.

Change-Id: I0bec885d6e5d4f4e1106f3bd2a90ba5f86395b07
Partial-Bug: 1347845

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-06-10 12:59:57.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'enables SR-IOV for networking
This is the first patch for this blueprint.

While keeping the existing PCI passthrough functionality intact, this patch
makes the following enhancements:
 -- whitelist:
    A whitelist entry is defined as:
      ["device_id":"<id>",]["product_id":"<id>",]
      ["address":"[[[[<domain>]:]<bus>]:][<slot>][.[<function>]]",]
      {"<tag>":"tag-value",}
    . <id> can be a '*' or a valid device/product id as displayed by the
      linux utility lspci
    . the address uses the same syntax as it in lspci. refer to lspci's manual
      for its description about the '-s' switch. In addition, you can also use
      ethernet interface names that represent SR-IOV physical functions. If the
      address corresponds to a SR-IOV physical function, all the PCI devices
      with virtual functions under the phsical function will match the entry.
    . the tag can be any string. But for scheduling purpose, only the tag
      "physical_network" is supported in this patch

    Multiple whitelist entries per host are supported as they already are.
    "device_id", "product_id", and "address" are fields that will be matched
    against PCI devices that are returned as a result of querying libvirt.

 -- examples of defining whitelist entries:
    pci_passthrough_whitelist = {"address":"eth0", \
                                 "physical_network":"physnet"}
    pci_passthrough_whitelist = {"address":"*:0a:00.*",
                                 "physical_network":"physnet1"}
    pci_passthrough_whitelist = {"address":":0a:00.",
                                 "physical_network":"physnet1"}
    pci_passthrough_whitelist = {"vendor_id":"1137","product_id":"0071"}

Change-Id: I96e3e0174fa79ef9dd0ffbec172ba1c0420a37f8
Implements: blueprint pci-passthrough-sriov

Change-Id: Id73bd0e0c9ffca05839f5869fc5194af4d06ef14
Implements: blueprint pci-passthrough-sriov

enables SR-IOV for networking
This is the first patch for this blueprint.

While keeping the existing PCI passthrough functionality intact, this patch
makes the following enhancements:
 -- whitelist:
    A whitelist entry is defined as:
      ["device_id":"<id>",]["product_id":"<id>",]
      ["address":"[[[[<domain>]:]<bus>]:][<slot>][.[<function>]]",]
      {"<tag>":"tag-value",}
    . <id> can be a '*' or a valid device/product id as displayed by the
      linux utility lspci
    . the address uses the same syntax as it in lspci. refer to lspci's manual
      for its description about the '-s' switch. In addition, you can also use
      ethernet interface names that represent SR-IOV physical functions. If the
      address corresponds to a SR-IOV physical function, all the PCI devices
      with virtual functions under the phsical function will match the entry.
    . the tag can be any string. But for scheduling purpose, only the tag
      "physical_network" is supported in this patch

    Multiple whitelist entries per host are supported as they already are.
    "device_id", "product_id", and "address" are fields that will be matched
    against PCI devices that are returned as a result of querying libvirt.

 -- examples of defining whitelist entries:
    pci_passthrough_whitelist = {"address":"eth0", \
                                 "physical_network":"physnet"}
    pci_passthrough_whitelist = {"address":"*:0a:00.*",
                                 "physical_network":"physnet1"}
    pci_passthrough_whitelist = {"address":":0a:00.",
                                 "physical_network":"physnet1"}
    pci_passthrough_whitelist = {"vendor_id":"1137","product_id":"0071"}

Change-Id: I96e3e0174fa79ef9dd0ffbec172ba1c0420a37f8
Implements: blueprint pci-passthrough-sriov

This is the first patch for this blueprint.

While keeping the existing PCI passthrough functionality intact, this patch
makes the following enhancements:
 -- whitelist:
    A whitelist entry is defined as:
      ["device_id":"<id>",]["product_id":"<id>",]
      ["address":"[[[[<domain>]:]<bus>]:][<slot>][.[<function>]]",]
      {"<tag>":"tag-value",}
    . <id> can be a '*' or a valid device/product id as displayed by the
      linux utility lspci
    . the address uses the same syntax as it in lspci. refer to lspci's manual
      for its description about the '-s' switch. In addition, you can also use
      ethernet interface names that represent SR-IOV physical functions. If the
      address corresponds to a SR-IOV physical function, all the PCI devices
      with virtual functions under the phsical function will match the entry.
    . the tag can be any string. But for scheduling purpose, only the tag
      "physical_network" is supported in this patch

    Multiple whitelist entries per host are supported as they already are.
    "device_id", "product_id", and "address" are fields that will be matched
    against PCI devices that are returned as a result of querying libvirt.

-- examples of defining whitelist entries:
    pci_passthrough_whitelist = {"address":"eth0", \
                                 "physical_network":"physnet"}
    pci_passthrough_whitelist = {"address":"*:0a:00.*",
                                 "physical_network":"physnet1"}
    pci_passthrough_whitelist = {"address":":0a:00.",
                                 "physical_network":"physnet1"}
    pci_passthrough_whitelist = {"vendor_id":"1137","product_id":"0071"}

Change-Id: I96e3e0174fa79ef9dd0ffbec172ba1c0420a37f8
Implements: blueprint pci-passthrough-sriov

', 'number': 18}, {'created': '2014-08-04 18:01:27.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Enhance PCI whitelist

While keeping the existing PCI passthrough functionality intact, this patch
makes the following enhancements:

* allows aggregated declaration of PCI devices by using '*' and '.'
* allows tags to be associated with PCI devices.

A whitelist entry is defined as:
["device_id": "<id>",] ["product_id": "<id>",]
["address": "[[[[<domain>]:]<bus>]:][<slot>][.[<function>]]" |
"devname": "Ethernet Interface Name",]
"physical_network":"name string of the physical network"

<id> can be a '*' or a valid device/product id as displayed by the linux
utility lspci. The address uses the same syntax as it's in lspci. Refer to
lspci's manual for its description about the '-s' switch. The devname can be
a valid PCI device name. The only device names that are supported in this
specification are those that are displayed by the linux utility ifconfig -a
and correspond to either a PF or a VF on a vNIC. There may be 0 or more tags
associated with an entry.

If the device defined by the address or devname corresponds to a SR-IOV PF,
all the VFs under the PF will match the entry.
For SR-IOV networking, a pre-defined tag "physical_network" is used to define
the physical network that the devices are attached to.

Multiple whitelist entries per host are supported as they already are. The
fields device_id, product_id, and address or devname will be matched
against PCI devices that are returned as a result of querying libvirt.

Change-Id: I96e3e0174fa79ef9dd0ffbec172ba1c0420a37f8
Partially Implements: blueprint pci-passthrough-sriov

* allows tags to be associated with PCI devices.

A whitelist entry is defined as:
["device_id": "<id>",] ["product_id": "<id>",]
["address": "[[[[<domain>]:]<bus>]:][<slot>][.[<function>]]" |
"devname": "Ethernet Interface Name",]
"physical_network":"name string of the physical network"

<id> can be a '*' or a valid device/product id as displayed by the linux
utility lspci. The address uses the same syntax as it's in lspci. Refer to
lspci's manual for its description about the '-s' switch. The devname can be

specification are those that are displayed by the linux utility ifconfig -a
and correspond to either a PF or a VF on a vNIC. There may be 0 or more tags

all the VFs under the PF will match the entry.
For SR-IOV networking, a pre-defined tag "physical_network" is used to define
the physical network that the devices are attached to.

Multiple whitelist entries per host are supported as they already are. The
fields device_id, product_id, and address or devname will be matched
against PCI devices that are returned as a result of querying libvirt.

commit_message:
Enhance PCI whitelist

While keeping the existing PCI passthrough functionality intact, this patch
makes the following enhancements:

* allows aggregated declaration of PCI devices by using '*' and '.'
* allows tags to be associated with PCI devices.

A whitelist entry is defined as:
["device_id": "<id>",] ["product_id": "<id>",]
["address": "[[[[<domain>]:]<bus>]:][<slot>][.[<function>]]" |
"devname": "Ethernet Interface Name",]
"physical_network":"name string of the physical network"

<id> can be a '*' or a valid device/product id as displayed by the linux
utility lspci. The address uses the same syntax as it's in lspci. Refer to
lspci's manual for its description about the '-s' switch. The devname can be
a valid PCI device name. The only device names that are supported in this
specification are those that are displayed by the linux utility ifconfig -a
and correspond to either a PF or a VF on a vNIC. There may be 0 or more tags
associated with an entry.

If the device defined by the address or devname corresponds to a SR-IOV PF,
all the VFs under the PF will match the entry.
For SR-IOV networking, a pre-defined tag "physical_network" is used to define
the physical network that the devices are attached to.

Multiple whitelist entries per host are supported as they already are. The
fields device_id, product_id, and address or devname will be matched
against PCI devices that are returned as a result of querying libvirt.

Change-Id: I96e3e0174fa79ef9dd0ffbec172ba1c0420a37f8
Partially Implements: blueprint pci-passthrough-sriov

commit_message:
Workaround for different floating_ip_pool results

In one cases result of clients.nova().floating_ip_pools.list()
is list of strings, in other cases it is list of dicts.

Related-Bug: #1355855

Change-Id: I39867702d13aaa9014440ce8d074852af9779547

commit_message:
Replace hard-coded setup version setting

The pbr library is used to generate version numbers for Barbican, and
should typically do so by forming the version using the latest tag
(such as '2014.2.b2') as a base version, and then appending git commit
info if after the tag. However, if setup.cfg has a 'version' property
set, this overrides the base version essentially 'hard coding' it. This
CR removes that override and instead lets the versionbuild.py script,
used during deployment processing, generate this version override based
on the current PBR generated version with a timestamp injected into it.

Closes-Bug: #1349238
Change-Id: I32cf9b32265569c1e2ae182efa32a0d1449de15c

commit_message:
Introduce nova::config + Update nova::config example description.

Add a new class nova::config which allows the creation and
management of arbitrary nova_config and nova_api_paste_ini resources.

This will add the ability for the end user to use Hiera to manage
those resources.

The original example in nova::config is syntax invalid.
Besides fixing that, this patch also gives an example in yaml format.

(cherry-picked from 40188356 and 133d5da1 in master)
Change-Id: Iad7a2b764884887a75f5f6db3e1660644e07c5c0

commit_message:
fix missing host when unshelving

An instance has the hostname of the host on which it is running.
The hostname is deleted when shelving. However, the hostname is not
recreated when unshelving.

This patch sets the hostname when unshelving.

Change-Id: I2e431718198321c46b9335e6fb7ab7be3943fab6
Closes-Bug: #1237868
(cherry picked from commit 9532e4ed969e47826801b14aff40dd9e356f2677)

commit_message:
Update the yum install maven in README

Maven does not install on "yum install maven3" on Fedora20.
Searching for Maven3 package does not give any results.
The correct way to install Maven3 on Fedora is to
run "yum install maven" instead.
This installs Maven3 and its dependencies.

I think we need to update the documentation with that.

Change-Id: Ie0a12ab0cb857e2af3d6e4157c54cc50b80df113

commit_message:
Check for property immutability in rsrc update

This patch adds check during resource update that the updated property
is not `immutable`. Otherwise update raises NotSupported error and
resource update fails.

Change-Id: I91019cb34adfcbe67d8c802d4ce1ff7702656a7c
Implements: blueprint implement-aws-updates-not-supported

commit_message:
Make DriverBlockDevice save() context arg optional

We do not need to pass it explicitly since we wrap
BlockDeviceMapping object, which hold their own context.

Also remove an ugly use of get_admin_context() to get around the
limitation that existed previously.

Change-Id: Ide4d2e4e3fd1b456dec9e71939b63e913849c6cf

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 8786, 'name': 'Vladimir Kuklin', 'email': 'aglarendil@gmail.com', 'username': 'aglarendil'}, {'_account_id': 8971, 'name': 'Fuel CI', 'username': 'fuel-ci', 'inactive': True, 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 11827, 'name': 'Stanislaw Bogatkin', 'email': 'regs+ubuntu.com@sbog.ru', 'username': 'sbogatkin'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2014-08-06 16:29:35.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Don't stop docker containers from supervisor

ATTENTION: this solution conflicts with
https://review.openstack.org/112077

- Use SIGTERM instead of SIGINT for dhcrelay_monitor supervisor
  service, because we have "sleep 30" loop in the monitor script,
  so it will handle SIGINT only when sleep ends.
- Send KILL instead of INT to "dockerctl attach" process to make
  sure we don't stop any container during supervisor shutdown or
  restart. This should make supervisor restart much faster and
  it's safe for upgrade process since we're not shutting down any
  containers. Supervisor only monitors them and brings them up,
  but does not stop them.

Change-Id: I08b50cf6f6ca7a93f446d07096ad25909ff60893
Related-bug: #1350764

commit_message:
Don't stop docker containers from supervisor

ATTENTION: this solution conflicts with
https://review.openstack.org/112077

- Use SIGTERM instead of SIGINT for dhcrelay_monitor supervisor
  service, because we have "sleep 30" loop in the monitor script,
  so it will handle SIGINT only when sleep ends.
- Send KILL instead of INT to "dockerctl attach" process to make
  sure we don't stop any container during supervisor shutdown or
  restart. This should make supervisor restart much faster and
  it's safe for upgrade process since we're not shutting down any
  containers. Supervisor only monitors them and brings them up,
  but does not stop them.

Change-Id: I08b50cf6f6ca7a93f446d07096ad25909ff60893
Related-bug: #1350764

commit_message:
Allow keystone_authtoken middleware to use v3 API

Keystone auth_token middleware didn't allow OpenStack services to
verify tokens using the Identity V3 API. They had to use the V2
API. The patch fixes this, so that services can use either the V2 or
V3 API, depending on what is available.

Closes-Bug: 1207922
Change-Id: Ibe6adb6ac5c637356ca9d9f8ceba7aae0803b678

commit_message:
Fix dns search domain on upgrade from 5.0

Includes testing for sync dns fix. This hook
applies when /etc/resolv.conf domain does not
match content of /etc/fuel/astute.yaml. If
the values do not coincide, DNS_DOMAIN and
DNS_SEARCH are replaced with the domain value
of /etc/resolv.conf.

Change-Id: Ida11df222eeeb59635d1ec3d95303db8a5ebaa8b
Closes-Bug: #1355149

commit_message:
Remove outdated docstring for nova.network.manager

There was related-flags section to describe config options, but was
outdated and duplicated with config options' description in code.
So We should remove it.

Change-Id: Ie0e444810393c77f04c1adbafdeb83c99d970902

commit_message:
libvirt: remove pointless LibvirtBaseVIFDriver class

There is only one single VIF driver class these days, so it is
pointless having a LibvirtBaseVIFDriver base class to inherit
from.

Related-bug: #1302796
Change-Id: Ie132135f9b6cf5337782ee9d1611c05bd56557fe

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 170, 'name': 'Mike Perez', 'email': 'thingee@gmail.com', 'username': 'thingee'}, {'_account_id': 1926, 'name': 'Derek Higgins', 'email': 'derekh@redhat.com', 'username': 'derekh'}, {'_account_id': 6796, 'name': 'Giulio Fidente', 'email': 'gfidente@redhat.com', 'username': 'gfidente'}, {'_account_id': 6928, 'name': 'Ben Nemec', 'email': 'openstack@nemebean.com', 'username': 'bnemec'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2014-08-08 17:18:32.000000000', 'files': ['elements/nova/os-apply-config/etc/nova/nova.conf'], 'message': "Set cinder_catalog_info in nova.conf

This commit updates the default nova.conf for TripleO so that
we pin the default cinder_catalog_info to the Cinder V1
API.

Nova recently broken backwards compat for people using the
default (it changed from v1 -> v2 when no config was specified).

As TripleO requires v1 it won't hurt to go ahead and set it
in our default config while we wait for the Nova change to land.

Partial-bug: #1354021

Change-Id: I768c1867f862ff0f10fa98c78907405099c8ff93
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Set cinder_catalog_info in nova.conf

This commit updates the default nova.conf for TripleO so that
we pin the default cinder_catalog_info to the Cinder V1
API.

Nova recently broken backwards compat for people using the
default (it changed from v1 -> v2 when no config was specified).

As TripleO requires v1 it won't hurt to go ahead and set it
in our default config while we wait for the Nova change to land.

Partial-bug: #1354021

Change-Id: I768c1867f862ff0f10fa98c78907405099c8ff93

commit_message:
Use auth_token from keystonemiddleware

auth_token middleware in python-keystoneclient is deprecated and has
been moved to the keystonemiddleware repo.

This patch updates Ironic to use the new keystonemiddleware package.

Change-Id: Ifb48996867f9f51c4dbedde0e0d9476c2d2818b4
Closes-Bug: #1342274

subject: Fix /var/run SELinux file contexts
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1926, 'name': 'Derek Higgins', 'email': 'derekh@redhat.com', 'username': 'derekh'}, {'_account_id': 6928, 'name': 'Ben Nemec', 'email': 'openstack@nemebean.com', 'username': 'bnemec'}, {'_account_id': 7144, 'name': 'James Slagle', 'email': 'jslagle@redhat.com', 'username': 'slagle'}, {'_account_id': 7471, 'name': 'Richard Su', 'email': 'rwsu@redhat.com', 'username': 'rwsu'}, {'_account_id': 8532, 'name': 'Ryan Brady', 'email': 'rbrady@redhat.com', 'username': 'rbrady'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2014-07-22 02:45:46.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Fix /var/run SELinux file contexts

/var/run/<service> needs to be relabeled with the correct file
contexts. With systemd, these directories are created anew each
boot by /lib/systemd/system/<service>-create-dir.service.
os-svc-daemon was updated to call restorecon to correct the file
contexts.

keystone_var_run_t and neutron_var_run_t do not exist and
couldn't be use to call restorecon. os-svc-daemon was modified
to support a new -Z option which relabels the /var/run/<service>
directory with a specific type. For keystone and neutron,
keystone_var_lib_t and neutron_var_lib_t are used.

Note /var/run/swift's label remains incorrect. There is something
else writing to that directory. A separate fix for that issue will
be included in a subsequent change. Without that fix, devtest
still passes with SELinux in enforcing mode.

Change-Id: I6487d0726db08912eed3062dfee2552940eadcfb
Partial-Bug: 1346559
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2014-07-22 20:35:26.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Fix /var/run SELinux file contexts

/var/run/<service> needs to be relabeled with the correct file
contexts. With systemd, these directories are created anew each

commit_message:
Fix /var/run SELinux file contexts

/var/run/<service> needs to be relabeled with the correct file
contexts. With systemd, these directories are created anew each
boot by /lib/systemd/system/<service>-create-dir.service.
os-svc-daemon was updated to correct the file contexts.

Change-Id: I6487d0726db08912eed3062dfee2552940eadcfb
Closes-Bug: 1346559

commit_message:
Bump the size of the squid cache_dir.

We were seeing disk space over limit errors on our CI
squid cache box:

 WARNING: Disk space over limit

So bumping the the cache_dir sizes to 4 Gigs...

Also switching to aufs for async IO.

Change-Id: I560decfe0d4770577141a43c4f16f7ead76ad2d4

commit_message:
Fix mysql element on centos7

The distribution element for CentOS (there is only one) is called
centos7, so fix the check for the distribution name to make this
element behave when building a CentOS image.

Change-Id: Id329228c558e7adbb7d285503dde992df4495510

commit_message:
Trust unit tests should target additional threat scenarios

This adds unit tests for two threat scenarios around the trust functionality
that are not currently tested.

The first scenario is related to deletion of a grant that has been previously
delegated via a trust. We need to ensure that executing a trust for a role that
the trustor no longer has is rejected.

The second scenario is related to an attempt to use a trust token with
impersonation to execute another trust as the impersonated user. We need to
ensure that a trust token can't be used to execute another trust.

SecurityImpact
Closes-Bug: #1347909
Change-Id: Ie1a0c286ff7e513cd964d4a93855230c78b98c6c

', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2014-07-29 03:07:54.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Allow empty volumes to be created

The following patch allows an empty volume to be created and
attached to an instance at boot time. Today, you can define a
bootable volume that is sourced from an image, volume, or
snapshot. However, you cannot define a volume that is sourced
from 'blank', even though it is one of the source options
available. For example, the following command will not work:
nova boot --flavor m1.tiny
--block-device source=blank,dest=volume,size=1,bootindex=0 test.
This is because the method used to identify ephemeral volumes
(new_format_is_ephemeral) believes any block device with
source_type=blank is an ephemeral, and there is no logic to
handle volumes where source_type=blank. The following patch
fixes these bugs by properly identifying ephemeral block
devices and creating blank/empty volumes when source_type=blank
and destination_type=volume.

commit_message:
Allow empty volumes to be created

The following patch allows an empty volume to be created and
attached to an instance at boot time. Today, you can define a
bootable volume that is sourced from an image, volume, or
snapshot. However, you cannot define a volume that is sourced
from 'blank', even though it is one of the source options
available. For example, the following command will not work:
nova boot --flavor m1.tiny
--block-device source=blank,dest=volume,size=1,bootindex=0 test.
This is because the method used to identify ephemeral volumes
(new_format_is_ephemeral) believes any block device with
source_type=blank is an ephemeral, and there is no logic to
handle volumes where source_type=blank. The following patch
fixes these bugs by properly identifying ephemeral block
devices and creating blank/empty volumes when source_type=blank
and destination_type=volume.

Change-Id: I5aa9684bfad1749fadff3018b13a225ed8f16fe8
Closes-Bug: #1347028
Closes-Bug: #1347499

commit_message:
VMWare: don't notify on disassociate_floatingips()

L3 agent notifications don't make sense for NSX VMWare plugin since
there is no L3 agent in such setup, so disabling them here.

Updated a unit test to check that notification is indeed not requested.

Conflicts:
	neutron/tests/unit/vmware/test_nsx_plugin.py

Change-Id: I9c7c32d02d466098d22df8f10448361c3d99174c
Related-Bug: 1330955
(cherry picked from commit eafebec2d3f6d0bd0ecc6e6d7c4f1ae421a44dfe)

commit_message:
Use config module from oslo-incubator

Use the config module from oslo-incubator to generate the config sample
file. The new code replaces the currently used scripts from tools/conf.
With the new generator and the oslo.config.generator.rc file
configuration options for oslo.messaging, olso.db, oslo.concurrency and
keystonemiddleware.auth_token are now visible in the config sample.

Change-Id: I48ef123df5841fef6c6ebf975efab4429b90ee93

commit_message:
Sync and update openstack-common components

* Add config module to openstack-common.conf for better config sample
  generation
* Sync modules from oslo-incubator
* Remove obsolete tools/conf dir - replaced by tools/config
* Add olso.config.generator.rc which leads to a more useful config
  example

Change-Id: Ia3dc363712eb9055babee7687e092d24fffb0198

Adds nova scripts for training labs

Adds nova scripts for training labs which will install and configure
nova.

Add page about tests to developer docs

Add page that explains how to run tests using tox and gives minimal
introduction to the test suite structure to the developers docs.

commit_message:
Restore rabbit.host and add an haproxy rabbit listener

To balance load over the rabbit cluster we want to route access
to it via haproxy.

This also helps workaround bug #856764 as an additional benefit.

This change sets rabbit.host to the ControlVirtualIP (to be used by
the elements) and adds an haproxy listener for the rabbit nodes.

Related to blueprint tripleo-icehouse-ha-production-configuration
Depends on I3ff37ec18b9191ca8e861519bed142cbdbd5faa2

Change-Id: I49b622a604542f456bd9a37da8dae3353218e640
Related-Bug: 856764

Typos and spell errors in admin-guide, arch-design and cli-reference

While spell-checking some openstack-manuals guides, some typos were found and
this patch address those in the first three directories of the manuals repo.

commit_message:
Add `immutable` property attribute

Currently resources support only in-place update or (default)
UpdateReplace. In order to support AWS "Updates are not supported"
feature, this new property attribute is added, with default value False.
It is going to be used for denying an UpdateReplace
behavior of the resource (similar to update_allowed currently).

Change-Id: Ie94241630d9595b58ff6b84bcb94459b0785fc03
Implements: blueprint implement-aws-updates-not-supported

commit_message:
fuel_upgrade: add apply puppet fixes hack

The fuel_upgrade script should be able to deliver fixes for puppet
manifests, since it's critical for OpenStack patching feature. The
system should be flexible and adding new puppet fixes should make
no pain.

Since now, the script searches a special folders in tarball for fixes
and install them if they are found.

Change-Id: Ic5f6881cab8c047b55dc0edec8ce1e377c776b17
Blueprint: upgrade-to-5-1

commit_message:
Backport puppet fixes from branch to tarball

We need to deliver puppet fixes for old releases, since it's very
important for openstack patching - without it a rollback will not
work.

The backported fixes are located under the same directories as on
master node. The fuel_upgrade script can deal with it since the
patch:

    https://review.openstack.org/#/c/113315/

Change-Id: I4643e237b595349041c6ada5be1d8be7967f13fc
Partial-Bug: #1352896

subject: Add check credentials to log message if rabbmitmq closes socket
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1247, 'name': 'Mark McLoughlin', 'email': 'markmc@redhat.com', 'username': 'markmc'}, {'_account_id': 1955, 'name': 'Alan Pevec', 'email': 'alan.pevec@redhat.com', 'username': 'apevec'}, {'_account_id': 4395, 'name': 'Aaron Rosen', 'email': 'aaronorosen@gmail.com', 'username': 'arosen'}, {'_account_id': 6159, 'name': 'Flavio Percoco Premoli', 'email': 'fpercoco@redhat.com', 'username': 'flaper87'}, {'_account_id': 7763, 'name': 'Alexei Kornienko', 'email': 'akornienko@mirantis.com', 'username': 'akornienko'}, {'_account_id': 11224, 'name': 'Swami Reddy', 'email': 'swamireddy@gmail.com', 'username': 'swamireddy'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2014-07-18 06:20:10.000000000', 'files': ['oslo/messaging/_drivers/impl_rabbit.py'], 'message': 'Add check credentials to log message if rabbmitmq closes socket

If one has the credentials misconfigured for rabbitmq currently the following
error message is shown: "AMQP server on 10.0.0.23:5672 is unreachable:
Socket closed. Trying again in 1 seconds. " This is confusing because the
problem is the login creditentials are wrong but the server can be reached.

Since the rabbmitmq server allowed the initial connection and closed the
socket it's likely an authenication issue. This patch now logs: "AMQP server
10.0.0.23:5672 closed the connection. Check login credentials: Socket closed"
to hint the user that it could be a credential issue.

Change-Id: Iadff35d88a9cf704c1edd2d5036a113966db3ea3
Closes-bug: 1325750
(cherry picked from commit bf281aace507dec7547e40f68d8cd7bb290dc903)
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Add check credentials to log message if rabbmitmq closes socket

If one has the credentials misconfigured for rabbitmq currently the following
error message is shown: "AMQP server on 10.0.0.23:5672 is unreachable:
Socket closed. Trying again in 1 seconds. " This is confusing because the
problem is the login creditentials are wrong but the server can be reached.

Since the rabbmitmq server allowed the initial connection and closed the
socket it's likely an authenication issue. This patch now logs: "AMQP server
10.0.0.23:5672 closed the connection. Check login credentials: Socket closed"
to hint the user that it could be a credential issue.

Change-Id: Iadff35d88a9cf704c1edd2d5036a113966db3ea3
Closes-bug: 1325750
(cherry picked from commit bf281aace507dec7547e40f68d8cd7bb290dc903)

subject: labs: fix reading tenant id
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 7007, 'name': 'Pranav Salunke', 'email': 'dguitarbite@gmail.com', 'username': 'dguitarbite'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2014-08-11 16:03:51.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'labs: fix reading tenant id

Currently, setup_neutron_controller is reading the string "id" from a
table that looks like this:

+-------------+----------------------------------+
|   Property  |              Value               |
+-------------+----------------------------------+
| description |          Service Tenant          |
|   enabled   |               True               |
|      id     | cfff80e213a246a3bd9a46b33d5084b2 |
|     name    |             service              |
+-------------+----------------------------------+

The actual tenant id it needs for configuration is in $4 (the pipes used
as separators in the table count as fields, too).

While we're at it, replace "service" with "$SERVICE_TENANT_NAME".

Change-Id: Id47d5c10ce426ff42237105c02f0dffdf4632cfc
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2014-08-12 10:26:24.000000000', 'files': ['labs/scripts/setup_neutron_controller.sh'], 'message': 'labs: fix reading tenant id

Currently, setup_neutron_controller is reading the string "id" rather
than the actual tenant id which is in $4 (the pipes used as separators
in the table count as fields, too).

While we're at it, replace "service" with "$SERVICE_TENANT_NAME".

Change-Id: Id47d5c10ce426ff42237105c02f0dffdf4632cfc
', 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
labs: fix reading tenant id

Currently, setup_neutron_controller is reading the string "id" rather
than the actual tenant id which is in $4 (the pipes used as separators
in the table count as fields, too).

While we're at it, replace "service" with "$SERVICE_TENANT_NAME".

Change-Id: Id47d5c10ce426ff42237105c02f0dffdf4632cfc

subject: Set python hash seed to 0 in tox.ini
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 3098, 'name': 'Jeff Peeler', 'email': 'jpeeler@redhat.com', 'username': 'jpeeler-z'}, {'_account_id': 4715, 'name': 'Angus Salkeld', 'email': 'asalkeld@redhat.com', 'username': 'asalkeld'}, {'_account_id': 6316, 'name': 'Anita Kuno', 'email': 'anteaya@anteaya.info', 'username': 'anteaya'}, {'_account_id': 6498, 'name': 'Divakar Padiyar Nandavar', 'email': 'divakar.padiyar-nandavar@hpe.com', 'username': 'divakar-padiyar-nandavar'}, {'_account_id': 7404, 'name': 'Ethan Lynn', 'email': 'xuanlangjian@gmail.com', 'username': 'GaryLynn'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2014-07-25 22:11:12.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': "Set python hash seed to 0 in tox.ini

New tox (>=1.7.0) sets a random python hash seed by default. This is
generally good for testing because it will help keep projects working
regardless of the hash seed, but heat unittests don't currently pass
with a random hash seed so set it to the python default seed.

This change will allow us to use new tox again and remove the
restriction on tox<=1.6.1 to run unittests.

Redundant setenvs for specific test envs are removed to prevent them
from overriding the PYTHONHASHSEED value.

Note this change will need to be backported to the stable branches to
keep unittests there working with new tox as well.

Change-Id: I2370759546adee7bf5e20fa214ed7fa1f31d6bfe
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Set python hash seed to 0 in tox.ini

New tox (>=1.7.0) sets a random python hash seed by default. This is
generally good for testing because it will help keep projects working
regardless of the hash seed, but heat unittests don't currently pass
with a random hash seed so set it to the python default seed.

This change will allow us to use new tox again and remove the
restriction on tox<=1.6.1 to run unittests.

Redundant setenvs for specific test envs are removed to prevent them
from overriding the PYTHONHASHSEED value.

Note this change will need to be backported to the stable branches to
keep unittests there working with new tox as well.

Change-Id: I2370759546adee7bf5e20fa214ed7fa1f31d6bfe

commit_message:
Make pre blocks horizontally-scrollable

Add the moment entries with code example/outputs inside pre blocks
can overlap the list of subscriptions on the right side. With
this patch overlapping entries will be displayed inside a
horizontally-scrollable box.

commit_message:
Do not abort on first failure

If multiple check arguments are given, do not exit after first failure
but continue and report all failed tests.
Enhance profile check to not abort after the first error.
Remove option --ignore-errors, this is not needed anymore.

Change-Id: I79996258a5d53b42cd57b11a0940ea4d6d18af5a

subject: Use which instead of type to check if a binary exists
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 167, 'name': 'Christian Berendt', 'email': 'berendt@osism.tech', 'username': 'berendt'}, {'_account_id': 6547, 'name': 'Andreas Jaeger', 'email': 'jaegerandi@gmail.com', 'username': 'jaegerandi'}, {'_account_id': 7923, 'name': 'Gauvain Pocentek', 'email': 'gauvainpocentek@gmail.com', 'username': 'gpocentek'}, {'_account_id': 11109, 'name': 'Roger Luethi', 'email': 'rl@patchworkscience.org', 'username': 'rluethi'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2014-08-11 19:48:00.000000000', 'files': ['os_doc_tools/doctest.py'], 'message': 'Use which instead of type to check if a binary exists

For example if mvn is a defined shell function but mvn is
not installed the method ensure_exists will return True even
mvn is not installed.

% type mvn
mvn is a shell function

% which mvn
/usr/bin/which: no mvn in (...)

Change-Id: Ic751660c030e687ca6bc53656fd49c5563cfc71f
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Use which instead of type to check if a binary exists

For example if mvn is a defined shell function but mvn is
not installed the method ensure_exists will return True even
mvn is not installed.

% type mvn
mvn is a shell function

% which mvn
/usr/bin/which: no mvn in (...)

Change-Id: Ic751660c030e687ca6bc53656fd49c5563cfc71f

commit_message:
Fixed setting GUID on cephjournals for ubuntu

The issue was that pmanager created ceph-journal partitions (one for
every ceph-osd) but guid was set for only one ceph-journal partition.

Change-Id: I50e3edc6f22310ec2ba541d677bffe1896c28fe7
Closes-Bug: #1355342

commit_message:
Fix image killed after deletion

If an image upload fails after the image was deleted during
the upload, the image status currently gets set to 'deleted'
then 'killed' once the upload fails. This patch fixes this so
that if the image was deleted it stays in 'deleted' state.

Permitted from_states for transitioning to 'killed' are
'queued' and 'saving'. We now enforce this transition and
raise an exception if it is violated.

Closes-Bug: 1236868
Co-authored-by: Hirofumi Ichihara <ichihara.hirofumi@lab.ntt.co.jp>
Co-authored-by: Zhi Yan Liu <zhiyanl@cn.ibm.com>
Change-Id: I5552220ce264c0d09780bbd0eb7610e7cff0b820

commit_message:
Make swift tempurl key secret

This prevents the key from being printed out to logs when e.g.
`log_opt_values` is called.

Change-Id: I7c7f8987a467476f4d56fa76c6a35c88561d6858

commit_message:
Don't restart rabbitmq via service in zabbix

In HA environments we manage rabbitmq via pacemaker so restarting
it via "service" won't work correctly.
Also, during deployment we can enable plugins before starting
rabbitmq service.

Change-Id: I6e0eeb9147801a430b73fdb00fa106b8d79c9476
Closes-bug: #1350853

commit_message:
Don't set tunnel_types on VLAN network type

The current code sets tunnel types for the neutron agent
even when the network type is 'vlan'. This results in the
agent not starting because 'vlan' is not a valid tunnel type.
This patch changes it so tunnel_types is not populated when
vlans are used.

This bug just now surfaced because of commit
8feaf6c9516094df58df84479d73779e87a79264 requiring Q_ML2_TENANT_NETWORK_TYPE
to be set to avoid being set to the 'local' type.

Change-Id: If2bc57b36dad2bfb34df573581acce176604812e

[{'created': '2014-04-23 13:51:40.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Ignore the key if it hasn't the capabilities namespace

There are two problems in this filter.
One is that it doesn't ignore the extra spect key if
it hasn't the 'capabilities' namespace.

The other is that if the extra spects are some of this:
- (capabilities:cpu_info:vendor, Intel)
- (capabilities:cpu_info:topology:cores, 2)

The patch fix both cases. The first by fixing the
indentation of the 'if' block and the other by parsing
the cpu_info to dict.

commit_message:
Parse unicode cpu_info as json before using it

If the extra specs are some of this:
- (capabilities:cpu_info:vendor, Intel)
- (capabilities:cpu_info:topology:cores, 2)
- (capabilities:cpu_info:features, <in> rdtscp)

It doesn't work because the cpu_info is loaded as unicode in HostState.
The patch fix these cases by parsing the cpu_info to dict.
Update: use six.string_types instead of unicode.

Change-Id: Ieabf95b1e3e5893ced16c0571c29b13b252df5d1
Closes-Bug: #1331176
Co-Authored-By: Pawel Koniszewski <pawel.koniszewski@intel.com>

commit_message:
Corrects some inconsistencies in REST API spec

Changes ids in json examples to uuids.
Changes example for adding role to plan to contain name and version.
Changes /v2/clouds to /v2/plans.

Change-Id: Id242a877b38409978ef337a1e4f5cc5955b21b95

commit_message:
Improved error logging in nova-network for allocate_fixed_ip()

When a Nova deployment runs out of fixed IP addresses, allocating
another IP ends with stack trace without clear explanation.
To prevent such behavior this patch introduces few try-except blocks
that writes appropriate error message to the log file and return
better error code via API instead of stack trace.

Change-Id: I8111ae883719ad693113e1d3bfedc8685427c55f
Closes-Bug: #1218572

commit_message:
Add openstack actions

 * Added Generator for OpenStack Actions
 * Added Nova actions
 * Added Keystone actions
 * Added Glance actions
 * Init all needed namespaces in action factory
 * Unit tests of generators and engine

Implements blueprint: mistral-openstack-actions

Change-Id: I2ac24843e6434c513ebc813cbe42f91000309918

commit_message:
Fix some calls after switch to 'requests'

* Just one value is returned
* 'status' response attribute is now called 'status_code'
* Method log_http_response decoded requests content, which is unnessesary

Change-Id: I6308b78bb40a547bdaef02f44d815eb482524b15
Closes-Bug: #1355133

commit_message:
Enable H104, F841 hacking rule and fix violations

This change enables hacking check H104 and F841, and fixes all
violations.

[H104]    Files with no code shouldnt contain any license header nor
          comments, and must be left completely empty.
[F841]    local variable name is assigned to but never used

Change-Id: If7fcb737d121fd13b2b103d63f5f26dfaa79c59b

commit_message:
Optimize db.floating_ip_deallocate

'select for update' and 'update' operations
were combined into a single 'update' operation

problems with 'select for update' relate to
spec https://review.openstack.org/#/c/97310/1

now 'floating_ip_deallocate' function returns
number of updated rows in db

Partial-Bug: #1343613

Change-Id: I60f5a8f3e1541983dea1589783927107c00c5fa4

commit_message:
Add clear_bond_configuration for removed nodes on cluster update

Now bonds configuration is removed in all situations. Tests added.
More generally, we need to DRY node removal code in those two places.

Closes-Bug: #1354492

Change-Id: I138df23b6a1da292ab928b59c479a1f3d7ba05a2

commit_message:
Rename Trove create database dialog

To ensure consistency with the rest of the Trove screens and CLI,
and to be consistent with other OpenStack components we are renaming
the Trove Launch Database dialog to be Launch Instance

Changed the name of the dialog and references to Database Instance
in the dialog

Change-Id: I07e87c1945da4c5355f03a034f1649a546e0a192
Closes-Bug: #1324616

commit_message:
Rollback quota in os_tenant_network

when we call API with 'os_tenant_networks' to delete an existing network
it might fail due to unexpected reason, we should rollback the
quota we reserved otherwise we will face no quota later.

Change-Id: Ic74a7a8df337070f17b1ea6916809fa93880a287
Closes-Bug: 1296489

commit_message:
Add method for deallocating networks on reschedule

Per nova baremetal commit d3854f2c05502c7407d716da7d1bd7f1ca3e0a15
we should now return True from the deallocate_networks_on_reschedule
Nova compute Ironic driver.

Change-Id: I54a3252ab15e2d8b596ccc90eb4755405021f1da

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-07-18 14:35:08.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Enable custom BUILD_TIMEOUT

Some drivers take a little more time to build a VM than others.
This patch enable the possiblity to pass a different build timeout
for these cases.

Change-Id: I260c32e7ed6bf9a49a6bc40272a5535afbca2731
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2014-07-18 14:45:35.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Enable custom BUILD_TIMEOUT

The BUILD_TIMEOUT is hardcoded in lib/tempest. This patch
enables people to pass a custom BUILD_TIMEOUT parameter

Change-Id: I260c32e7ed6bf9a49a6bc40272a5535afbca2731
', 'number': 2}, {'created': '2014-07-28 15:49:11.000000000', 'files': ['lib/tempest'], 'message': 'Enable custom BUILD_TIMEOUT

The BUILD_TIMEOUT is hardcoded in lib/tempest. This patch
enables people to pass a custom BUILD_TIMEOUT parameter

Change-Id: I260c32e7ed6bf9a49a6bc40272a5535afbca2731
', 'number': 3}]
commit_message:
Enable custom BUILD_TIMEOUT

The BUILD_TIMEOUT is hardcoded in lib/tempest. This patch
enables people to pass a custom BUILD_TIMEOUT parameter

Change-Id: I260c32e7ed6bf9a49a6bc40272a5535afbca2731

commit_message:
Clean whitespace off token.

A bogus, non-visible character may be appended to the token.
If it is, the hash will not match the original, and the token
will be incorrectly reported as invalid.

Change-Id: I7b2c831b85818a8c07616f44c1d501701c9d72f8
Closes-Bug: 1354765

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-08-07 22:11:54.000000000', 'files': ['grenade.sh'], 'message': "Consult target when deciding to upgrade service

The target side's enabled services should be queried when determining
whether or not to upgrade a service.  This allows sideways upgrades

Change-Id: I94569b35342d20fd5ef4d92d3f97cee6cfc42291
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Consult target when deciding to upgrade service

The target side's enabled services should be queried when determining
whether or not to upgrade a service.  This allows sideways upgrades
that involve adding or removing services during the upgrade/migration.

Change-Id: I94569b35342d20fd5ef4d92d3f97cee6cfc42291

[{'created': '2014-06-19 17:52:27.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'address bashate style violations

commit_message:
address bashate style violations

these were mostly inconsistent indentation, there were a couple of
blocks that came over with 2 space indents, even though the prevailing
indent is 4.

One issue found with function foo() {, again the prevailing style is
function foo {, so enforcing that rule seems appropriate.

Change-Id: I5761064a758eddccd27979e2a71925e004e9ccc8

commit_message:
On Python <= 2.6, use simplejson if available

Until Python 2.7, stdlib json module was not boosted with a C extension,
meaning bad performance. Try to use simplejson module if available.

RHEL 6.5 is one of the platforms that still ship Python 2.6.

The original idea of the patch belongs to Miguel Angel Ajo Pelayo @
mangelajo@redhat.com

Conflicts:
	openstack/common/jsonutils.py

Change-Id: Ib3dc0b713ed90396919feba018772243b3b9c90f
Closes-Bug: 1314129
(cherry picked from commit a6b2aecf3a75e4bdef493b645112a7944bced1e1)

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-05-27 12:58:15.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Enforce unicode json output for jsonutils.load[s]()

simplejson module applies some optimizations on ASCII-only unicode
strings which result in non-unicode json output. See details at [1]
and [2]. To make sure we always return consistent json output no
matter which json implementation is used, we should explicitly convert
the input for json.load[s]() to unicode.

If user wants to pass a file object of non UTF-8 encoding to
json.load[s](), she must also specify this encoding as an argument. To
support this scenario too, we've added 'encoding' argument to
jsonutils.load[s]() implementation.

Made all present JSON tests to run on both supported json library
implementations.

Added explicit dependency for simplejson to be able to test different
implementations in unit tests. Distributors still running Python 2.6
are recommended but not required to install simplejson.

Related-Bug: 1314129

[1]: https://code.djangoproject.com/ticket/11742
[2]: https://code.google.com/p/simplejson/issues/detail?id=40

Conflicts:
	test-requirements-py3.txt
	tests/unit/test_jsonutils.py

commit_message:
Enforce unicode json output for jsonutils.load[s]()

simplejson module applies some optimizations on ASCII-only unicode
strings which result in non-unicode json output. See details at [1]
and [2]. To make sure we always return consistent json output no
matter which json implementation is used, we should explicitly convert
the input for json.load[s]() to unicode.

If user wants to pass a file object of non UTF-8 encoding to
json.load[s](), she must also specify this encoding as an argument. To
support this scenario too, we've added 'encoding' argument to
jsonutils.load[s]() implementation.

Made all present JSON tests to run on both supported json library
implementations.

Added explicit dependency for simplejson to be able to test different
implementations in unit tests. Distributors still running Python 2.6
are recommended but not required to install simplejson.

Related-Bug: 1314129

[1]: https://code.djangoproject.com/ticket/11742
[2]: https://code.google.com/p/simplejson/issues/detail?id=40

Conflicts:
	test-requirements-py3.txt
	tests/unit/test_jsonutils.py

Change-Id: Ic815ca3df94c33edec9104172048b2cd94b92e3f
(cherry picked from commit 18f2bc1bf080b41a22c70842e7c127da21c63b8b)

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 6491, 'name': 'xing-yang', 'email': 'xingyang105@gmail.com', 'username': 'xing-yang'}, {'_account_id': 8851, 'name': 'Valeriy Ponomaryov', 'email': 'kiparis.kh@gmail.com', 'username': 'vponomaryov'}, {'_account_id': 12631, 'name': 'Bogun Dmitriy', 'email': 'dbogun@mirantis.com', 'username': 'dbogun'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2014-08-07 09:33:13.000000000', 'files': ['manila/network/linux/ip_lib.py'], 'message': 'Remove dangerous arguments default

Method manila.network.linux.ip_lib.IpNetnsCommand.execute use mutable
object as default value for argument addl_env. In 99% cases this lead to
incorrect results and it is too difficult to track what is the source of
the problem.

You never should use mutable default value for function/method argument.
Unless you really know what are you doing.

Change-Id: Iba93e55f2ead5bfc0fd4986d49f872783cf64d99
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Remove dangerous arguments default

Method manila.network.linux.ip_lib.IpNetnsCommand.execute use mutable
object as default value for argument addl_env. In 99% cases this lead to
incorrect results and it is too difficult to track what is the source of
the problem.

You never should use mutable default value for function/method argument.
Unless you really know what are you doing.

Change-Id: Iba93e55f2ead5bfc0fd4986d49f872783cf64d99

commit_message:
Rename instance_type to flavor in notifications

Renames 'instance_type' to 'flavor' in the notifications module except
for the 'instance_type' key in the notifications payload. The related tests
are also updated.

Part of blueprint flavor-instance-type-dedup

Change-Id: I448146b205ca0efcd26904011e738ac77f46b89d

commit_message:
Remove deprecated glance commands from javelin setup

There are some deprecated commands being used in the javelin setup
they should be removed since we are removing all the deprecated
glance client commands in this patch
http://review.openstack.org/#/c/108804/

Change-Id: Ieb05c7ba2959c26c987667dba751e94b899772af

commit_message:
F811: remove all warnings

The patch removes all warning of the form:-
  'redefinition of unused name from line N'

For example:

"./nova/network/manager.py:191:1: F811 redefinition of
 unused 'uuid' from line 49"

Change-Id: I31750143cf58930e3ef388e842543ee20bfca337
