revisions:
[{'created': '2014-08-08 14:56:24.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Make intermittent failures in tests permanent

This change addresses some intermittent failures in tests that we've
been seeing recently. The failure would typically manifest itself in
test_prepare_from_backup test in test_mongodb_manager.py but in theory
it could occur elsewhere.

The good thing about this change is that it will make the intermittent
failures persistent. But, thanks to the fix for 1353570 (change
I22d839f) the failures won't happen any longer. This change, without
the earlier change for 1353570 did in fact serve to make the
intermittent failures permanent, hence the commit title.

The issue is that GuestAgentBackupTest didn't unpatch
execute_with_timeout when it was done. This meant that tests running
after it were running in an environment where execute_with_timeout was
patched. But, just in case you had a test which didn't itself patch
execute_with_timeout and it happened to run on a thread that hadn't
run GuestAgentBackupTest, you'd get a bad result.

The fix is to include code to save and restore execute_with_timeout in
setUp and tearDown.

Change-Id: I60187145d25524b4e7614d5d8cce9027521db44c
Closes-Bug: #1347337

commit_message:
Correct monkey patching in GuestAgentBackupTest

This change addresses some intermittent failures in tests that we've
been seeing recently.

The failure would typically manifest itself in
test_prepare_from_backup test in test_mongodb_manager.py but in theory
it could occur elsewhere. The good thing about this change is that it
will make the intermittent failures persistent. But, thanks to the fix
for bug 1353570 (change I22d839f) the failures won't happen any
longer.

This change, without the earlier change for bug 1353570 did in fact
serve to make the intermittent failures permanent. The issue is that
GuestAgentBackupTest didn't unpatch execute_with_timeout when it was
done. This meant that tests running after it were running in an
environment where execute_with_timeout was patched. But, just in case
you had a test which didn't itself patch execute_with_timeout and it
happened to run on a thread that hadn't run GuestAgentBackupTest,
you'd get a bad result.

The fix is to include code to save and restore execute_with_timeout in
setUp and tearDown.

Change-Id: I60187145d25524b4e7614d5d8cce9027521db44c
Closes-Bug: #1347337

commit_message:
Convert network/api.py to use FloatingIP object

This converts floating IP manipulation code in the network/api.py
module to use the FloatingIP object. Basically no testing of these
interfaces was being done, so this adds that as well.

Related to blueprint compute-manager-objects-juno

Change-Id: I6120dd4a32473ca9029832503444fbeae1ab0576

commit_message:
Fix unit tests to succeed on any PYTHONHASHSEED

Many tests rely on order of parameters in URL query, but
queries are constructed from dicts and order of parameters
is non-deterministic. The issue doesn't occur if PYTHONHASHSEED
stays constant, but breaks if random. The fix is needed for
tox>1.7 and Py3.

Closes-Bug: 1348818

Change-Id: I01145df689e90ccd6100fa82092ba3ed222af8fc

commit_message:
Update oslo incubator code to commit 0b02fc0f36814968

gettextutils
 - de4adbc4 (pep8: fixed multiple violations)
importutils
 - 1173e46981a6d (Remove ValueError when accessing sys.modules)
jsonutils
 - 0d7296f6885 (Add kwargs to jsonutils.load(s) functions)
network_utils
 - 9502a21bfcc (Use the standard python logging in network_utils)
 - e433899db279743 (Enable configuring tcp keepalive)
 - 29a95c2ce11f9 (Avoid raising index error when no host)
strutils
 - cb5a804bd4 (Move `mask_password` to strutils)
timeutils
 - 250cd88c4040c1f9 (Fixed a new pep8 error and a small typo)

commit_message:
Remove skipping flavor_access_add/remove related tests

At change Ibf741059c3a7a94543f1a2230fe7048692e1db0c, skip the
flavor_access_add/remove related tests for changing 'tenant' to
'project' in nova v3 REST API. But the v3 API plan is changed,
this kind of change will be introduce back when we have micro-version.
So remove the skip decorator for now.

Change-Id: I9ba1f0c10b7e976df303a9800bea2eea62f43891

commit_message:
Add API filtering to paged tables

This adds the ability to filter paged tables (admin instances,
admin images, and project instances) based on supported API
query attributes.

Change-Id: I53cae922e3d349e2f01e8d0d688ddf04d65d84e4
Implements: blueprint table-filtering-by-api-query

The two tests modified here were incorrectly defining

commit_message:
Redefine instance.security_groups as list

The two tests modified here were incorrectly defining
instance.security_groups as a single value instead of a list.

Apparently Django 1.7 is no longer happy trying to iterate something that
is not an iterable.

The other test_instance_details_*() were already doing the correct
thing so just copy over the logic.

Change-Id: I3ea2525927f9adbc1f000a03b5aedfbcb2595c02

commit_message:
Provide support for nested objects

With the introduction of the LBaaS v2 API, all objects are capable
of normal CRUD operations. Until now these objects were mostly top-level
constructs, and in then instances where they weren't, they were
manipulated by way of 'actions.'

LBaaS v2, as designed, nests members under pools, and supports all
normal CRUD operations. This means that in order to take action against
a member we need to provide a pool uuid as well as the member uuid. The
python-neutronclient currently does not support this, so this change
makes to possible to do so.

This change adds the capability but does not affect other top-level
object implemenations.

Change-Id: I38c3b78dc077f1f78ebc7e703fe7277a02f53f7a
Partially-implements: blueprint lbaas-api-and-objmodel-improvement

commit_message:
WBE request message validation

Add receive validation of the request message
sent by executors to workers to initiate work
requests so that we can be more robust around
invalid message formats being sent and received.

Part of blueprint wbe-message-validation

Change-Id: If7fc4c870252b6ef29e626a874e42c82d3879512

Change-Id: I7300d6f2d00e48c4f989c7f958a028bdff4afdd4
', 'number': 7}]
commit_message:
WBE notification message validation

Add send and receive validation of the notify
message that is sent between executors and workers
to be more robust around invalid message formats
being sent and received.

Part of blueprint wbe-message-validation

Change-Id: I7300d6f2d00e48c4f989c7f958a028bdff4afdd4

commit_message:
Remove hard-coded static prefix from JS and CSS files

Use global variable STATIC_URL in JavaScript, use relative
urls instead of absolute in CSS files.

Change-Id: Ib89d95c4cb425479e3e7af3d8b38292b3a335faa
Closes-Bug: #1342079

commit_message:
Create drivers/contrib directory

Based on the ML discussion thread, move drivers with upstream CI testing
to drivers/main and move all others to drivers/contrib/ directories.

(*) http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2014-July/039966.html

Change-Id: Ida37c940a72f271e5ed9f7fa36d9120f651d9d3c

commit_message:
Don't validate parameters when loading a stack

All kinds of Frankentemplates can now be stored in the database. We don't
want to refuse to load them again. Only validate the parameters when we
actually validate the stack.

Change-Id: I8bff116f1a9c16be2bd10a8da685ef9571e1101f
Closes-bug: #1354962

commit_message:
docs - Set pbr 'warnerrors' option for doc build

By setting this pbr option in setup.cfg, the doc build will fail in case
of any warnings or errors occur during the build process.

Closes-Bug: #1351350

Change-Id: Id4858062d2aaa4c2fe5b597e40e4e8947f544a4d

commit_message:
Remove unneeded definitions of Python Source Code Encoding

PEP 0263 (http://legacy.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0263/) is not
used anywhere else and should be removed when it's not needed.

Change-Id: I3f3d56b28001e2b27a4a749ecc9b3ac1c80a5b5c

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-08-07 10:46:25.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Use correct parameter for remove_multipath_device

In cinder/brick/initiator/connector.py, here is how
remove_multipath_device is used in ISCSIConnector.disconnect_volume.
remove_multipath_device will do nothing due to this use.

 multipath_device = self._get_multipath_device_name(host_device)
 if multipath_device:
    device_realpath = os.path.realpath(host_device)
    self._linuxscsi.remove_multipath_device(device_realpath)

But LinuxSCSI.remove_multipath_device is expecting a device UUID
instead of device_realpath.

The code should be changed to
 multipath_device = self._get_multipath_device_name(host_device)
 if multipath_device:
    self._linuxscsi.remove_multipath_device(
        multipath_device.split('/')[3])

CCLA SCHEDULE B SUBMISSION

Change-Id: Ifc081f58eecae4398ea87e216c3e13c1e1b90e07
Closes-Bug: #1353889

commit_message:
remove_multipath_device is used incorrectly

In cinder/brick/initiator/connector.py, here is how
remove_multipath_device is used in ISCSIConnector.disconnect_volume.
remove_multipath_device will do nothing due to this use.

 multipath_device = self._get_multipath_device_name(host_device)
 if multipath_device:
    device_realpath = os.path.realpath(host_device)
    self._linuxscsi.remove_multipath_device(device_realpath)

But LinuxSCSI.remove_multipath_device is expecting a device UUID
instead of device_realpath.

The code should be changed to
 multipath_device = self._get_multipath_device_name(host_device)
 if multipath_device:
    self._linuxscsi.remove_multipath_device(
        multipath_device.split('/')[-1])

Change-Id: Ifc081f58eecae4398ea87e216c3e13c1e1b90e07
Closes-Bug: #1353889

commit_message:
Remove metadata/metadetails from instance/server groups

This removes the half-implemented metadata implementation from server
groups. This first patch removes all uses of metadata/metadetails,
except what is required to handle existing API users that expect to see
an empty metadata key, and existing RPC clients expecting the same in
their InstanceGroup objects.

Change-Id: Ied2e8b058f9848e76222ca86e8f79105f08ea938

commit_message:
Implement Midonet Juno Network Api calls

This patch is the first in a series of converting the current midonet plugin
code to the new model described in blueprint midonet-plugin-juno. This patch
focuses specifically on the "network" handlers.

This patch also updates the midonet UT to handle the new objects that need
to be mocked with the new model.

Change-Id: I056d698ce2e312527e756ff56c962cff83a6bc04
Partially-Implements: blueprint midonet-plugin-juno

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-07-24 19:34:30.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Correct some IPAddress DB interaction in objects

We know that DB API methods want string addresses as parameters,
but often an object method will be called with data from that or
another object, which will be a netaddr.IPAddress in the case of
that sort of data. So, we should coerce those to strings to make
sure SA is happy.

This also fixes a small bit of DB-loading logic where a FloatingIP
would try to load its associated FixedIP explicitly. Obviously,
if it's not associated, it shouldn't try to do that.

Related to blueprint compute-manager-objects-juno

Change-Id: I97b4a86846020b58950f7c051cb003b7b09e938a

commit_message:
Correct some IPAddress DB interaction in objects

We know that DB API methods want string addresses as parameters,
but often an object method will be called with data from that or
another object, which will be a netaddr.IPAddress in the case of
that sort of data. So, we should coerce those to strings to make
sure SA is happy.

This also fixes a small bit of DB-loading logic where a FloatingIP
would try to load its associated FixedIP explicitly. Obviously,
if it's not associated, it shouldn't try to do that.

Related to blueprint compute-manager-objects-juno
Closes-bug: #1351020

Change-Id: I97b4a86846020b58950f7c051cb003b7b09e938a

commit_message:
Deprecate metadata_neutron_* configuration settings

Commit 5cacad3508570ce70b1f9ef620e0508169687fda created a
neutron configuration section. Move all of the metadata
neutron settings to that section.

DocImpact

The table below has the changes:

+-------------------------------------+------------------------------+
| 'DEFAULT' Section                   | 'neutron' Section            |
|-------------------------------------|------------------------------|
| service_neutron_metadata_proxy      | service_metadata_proxy       |
| neutron_metadata_proxy_shared_secret| metadata_proxy_shared_secret |
+-------------------------------------+------------------------------+

Change-Id: Id1b8b387e028c7752729f5c5b373c87397f7577a

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-07-24 01:11:24.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Remove assignment controller dependency on token_api

The assignment controller now uses the `validate_token` method on
the `token_provider_api` instead of referencing `get_token` directly
from the token persistence service.

The user_crud contrib (v2.0) extension now will emit an actual
token to the wire instead of the raw-internal data structure from
the token persistence backend. The intent here was clear by the
fact that the structure was built to look like a v2.0 token,
however, it was retriving the data from the persistence backend
and just updating the token_id then resaving the data before
emitting the raw persistence data (incorrect). The extension
now uses the issue_v2_token method from the token_provider_api.

This change is to ensure interactions with the token persitence
are consistent so that it is possible to support toggling
persistence of tokens.

Change-Id: I22b6b837731566bfd4dc61a47eec2eb0d336d4d1
bp: non-persistent-tokens

commit_message:
Remove assignment controller dependency on token_api

The assignment controller now uses the `validate_token` method on
the `token_provider_api` instead of referencing `get_token` directly
from the token persistence service.

The user_crud contrib (v2.0) extension now will emit an actual
token to the wire instead of the raw-internal data structure from
the token persistence backend. The intent here was clear by the
fact that the structure was built to look like a v2.0 token,
however, it was retriving the data from the persistence backend
and just updating the token_id then resaving the data before
emitting the raw persistence data (incorrect). The extension
now uses the issue_v2_token method from the token_provider_api.

This change is to ensure interactions with the token persitence
are consistent so that it is possible to support toggling
persistence of tokens.

Change-Id: I22b6b837731566bfd4dc61a47eec2eb0d336d4d1
bp: non-persistent-tokens

RESTful APIs are resource-oriented, and Keystone provides a
RESTful API, but the current way that routes are being mapped is
based on URLs rather than resources. With this change, the base

commit_message:
Enhance V3 router class for resources

RESTful APIs are resource-oriented, and Keystone provides a
RESTful API, but the current way that routes are being mapped is
based on URLs rather than resources. With this change, the base
Routers class is enhanced to support a resource-oriented way to
map paths to controllers and methods.

bp json-home

Change-Id: I0ba856845116b3ddd3dfed4608be65a87d9c01dc

commit_message:
Remove duplicate test of passing glance params

Simply removes a duplicate test of the passing of page size parameters
from the TestGlanceImageService and adds the page_size parameter and
check to the similar test in TestDetail.test_detail_params_passed() test
method.

commit_message:
handle AutoDiskConfigDisabledByImage at API layer

nova compute api layer might raise AutoDiskConfigDisabledByImage,
so API layer need to catch them and report correct info.
Also, create api handle lots of exceptions which inherit from Invalid,
this patch combined them and catch Invalid only.

Change-Id: Id0c89e96637d2f82b5bd204eba2c6291b9a5dd38

commit_message:
Correct returned HTTP status code (Use 403 instead of 413)

The exception HTTPRequestEntityTooLarge should not be used as an
exception response based on RFC2616. Because of that, change
the returned response to HTTPForbidden.

Restore commit for Iab090c40c632a76b0528df8145ad0897c8b649bf
And add compute V3 changes.

Related Tempest commit to match this change:
If376eda0a7929ba2baa4ac4acbb457883bcfc96d

DocImpact: corrects HTTP return code from 413 to 403 for quota-related
limit faults

Closes-Bug: #1298131
Change-Id: I2bb8a60ef254afbfed514cfeebe75355d0de4475

commit_message:
Introduce cinder:config to manage custom options

This cinder::config is aim to use cinder config resources
to manage custom configurations in cinder config files.

This will make end user easy to add their own custom options
in Hiera data.

Fully implements blueprint cinder-custom-config

(cherry-picked from 9b40aa5692c82ce25c0127bea4567d9e62b51a52)
Change-Id: I58faf3f4c76b2eb2077552036a239b60103ee965

commit_message:
Port image_size for V2.1 on V3 framework

Port the images_size from V2 to V2.1 (using the V3 framework).

TODO:
- input validation
- should probably just inherit off V2 tests
  and then add any additional tests required related
  to input validation

Partially implements blueprint v2-on-v3-api

Change-Id: I3dee01c98068a81404c2d3eeccb18b2efebfe773

commit_message:
WIP: Emulate v2 behavior for "create a private flavor" API

This patch adds v2 behavior of "create a private flavor" API on v3 API
method.

This way is a little durty due to adding v2 code into v3 method, but
the difference is small and the separation method seems overkill.

Partially implements blueprint v2-on-v3-api

Change-Id: Idd2bcd4f75aa1a7d6f05691d146ce4548aa2e1c5

commit_message:
WIP: Translate v2.1 "create/update/get server" API on v3 framework

This patch adds the translation for "create/update/get server" API.
The differences between v2 and v3 APIs are described on
https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/NovaAPIv2tov3

Partially implements blueprint v2-on-v3-api

Change-Id: I3d7f43e32eeeed2bc5389036297e5d0aeca68ef4

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-04-28 20:01:23.000000000', 'files': ['etc/nova/api-paste.ini'], 'message': 'WIP: Do v2.1 API PoC

To prove v2.1 API concept, the concept need to pass some Tempest
tests of Nova v2.0 API.

* "create a server" API and "get a server info" API
  tempest.api.compute.servers.test_servers.ServersTestJSON
    - test_create_server_with_admin_password
    - test_create_with_existing_server_name
    - test_create_server_with_ipv6_addr_only
* "create an agent" API
  tempest.api.compute.admin.test_agents.AgentsAdminTestJSON
    - test_create_agent
* "get console output" API
  tempest.api.compute.servers.test_server_actions.ServerActionsTestJSON
    - test_get_console_output
* "create private flavor" API
  tempest.api.compute.admin.test_flavors_access.FlavorsAccessTestJSON
    - test_flavor_access_list_with_private_flavor
* "get servers on the specified hypervisor" API
  tempest.api.compute.admin.test_hypervisor.HypervisorAdminTestJSON
    - test_get_hypervisor_show_servers
* images API
  tempest.api.compute.images.test_list_images.ListImagesTestJSON
    - test_get_image
    - test_list_images
    - test_list_images_with_detail
* volume-attach API
  tempest.api.compute.volumes.test_attach_volume.AttachVolumeTestJSON
    - test_attach_detach_volume
* volumes API
  tempest.api.compute.volumes.test_volumes_get.VolumesGetTestJSON
    - test_volume_create_get_delete
  tempest.api.compute.volumes.test_volumes_list.VolumesTestJSON
    - test_volume_list
    - test_volume_list_with_details
    - test_volume_list_param_limit
    - test_volume_list_with_detail_param_limit
    - test_volume_list_param_offset_and_limit
    - test_volume_list_with_detail_param_offset_and_limit

Partially implements blueprint v2-on-v3-api

commit_message:
WIP: Do v2.1 API PoC

To prove v2.1 API concept, the concept need to pass some Tempest
tests of Nova v2.0 API.

* "create a server" API and "get a server info" API
  tempest.api.compute.servers.test_servers.ServersTestJSON
    - test_create_server_with_admin_password
    - test_create_with_existing_server_name
    - test_create_server_with_ipv6_addr_only
* "create an agent" API
  tempest.api.compute.admin.test_agents.AgentsAdminTestJSON
    - test_create_agent
* "get console output" API
  tempest.api.compute.servers.test_server_actions.ServerActionsTestJSON
    - test_get_console_output
* "create private flavor" API
  tempest.api.compute.admin.test_flavors_access.FlavorsAccessTestJSON
    - test_flavor_access_list_with_private_flavor
* "get servers on the specified hypervisor" API
  tempest.api.compute.admin.test_hypervisor.HypervisorAdminTestJSON
    - test_get_hypervisor_show_servers
* images API
  tempest.api.compute.images.test_list_images.ListImagesTestJSON
    - test_get_image
    - test_list_images
    - test_list_images_with_detail
* volume-attach API
  tempest.api.compute.volumes.test_attach_volume.AttachVolumeTestJSON
    - test_attach_detach_volume
* volumes API
  tempest.api.compute.volumes.test_volumes_get.VolumesGetTestJSON
    - test_volume_create_get_delete
  tempest.api.compute.volumes.test_volumes_list.VolumesTestJSON
    - test_volume_list
    - test_volume_list_with_details
    - test_volume_list_param_limit
    - test_volume_list_with_detail_param_limit
    - test_volume_list_param_offset_and_limit
    - test_volume_list_with_detail_param_offset_and_limit

Partially implements blueprint v2-on-v3-api

Change-Id: I77524874345ed2d5fcc58d00699812938571bd01

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-04-28 20:01:23.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'WIP: Translate v2.1 API to v3 API

This patch is a prototype for translating v2 API to v3 API.

Working items:
 * Translate renamed attribute(request): Done
 * Translate renamed attribute(response without post_process_extensions): Done
 * Translate moved attribute(request): Done
 * Translate renamed attribute(response with post_process_extensions): TODO
 * Translate response code: TODO
 * Translate API url(Renamed url): TODO
 * Translate API url(Remove project-id from v2 API url): TODO
 * Distinguish API version from client header: TODO
   http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2014-February/028445.html
 * Test, test, test: TODO

PoC items:
 We need to prove this concept can cover differences between v2 and
 v3 API. There are some kinds of differences and I pick the following
 APIs as PoC targets. Please give a comment if you think the other
 APIs are better as PoC targets.
 * "create a server" API
    diff: Rename attributes of request/response
          Change attribute structure (scheduler_hints)
 * "change password" API
    diff: Rename attributes of request/response
          Change status code (202 -> 204)
 * "add tenant access to flavor" API
    diff: Rename API URL (os-flavor-access -> flavor-access)
          Rename attributes of request/response
 * "migrate_live a server" API
    diff: Rename action name (os-migrateLive -> migrate_live)
          Rename attributes of request

Change-Id: I71a805d5abd1d53fa7174c93cff5c11d0a58b2fc

', 'number': 16}, {'created': '2014-04-28 20:01:23.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "WIP: v2-on-v3-api translation framework

v2-on-v3-api translates a v2 API format request to the v3 request and
passes it to v3 API method. After the API method, it translates the v3
response to v2 format one again. From the viewpoint of client, Nova
can keep the backward compatibility of both request and response since
v2 API.

This patch provides API attribute translations:
  'rename_to': Rename API attribute name to the specified name
  'move_to'  : Move API attribute to the specified position
project-id handling in v2 API URL, and converts v2 response code.

Partially implements blueprint v2-on-v3-api

Change-Id: I71a805d5abd1d53fa7174c93cff5c11d0a58b2fc
", 'number': 31}, {'created': '2014-04-28 20:01:23.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "WIP: v2-on-v3-api translation framework

v2-on-v3-api translates a v2 API format request to the v3 request and
passes it to v3 API method. After the API method, it translates the v3
response to v2 format one again. From the viewpoint of client, Nova
can keep the backward compatibility of both request and response since
v2 API.

This patch provides API attribute translations:
  'rename_to': Rename API attribute name to the specified name
  'move_to'  : Move API attribute to the specified position

commit_message:
WIP: v2-on-v3-api translation framework

v2-on-v3-api translates a v2 API format request to the v3 request and
passes it to v3 API method. After the API method, it translates the v3
response to v2 format one again. From the viewpoint of client, Nova
can keep the backward compatibility of both request and response since
v2 API.

This patch provides API attribute translations:
  'rename_to': Rename API attribute name to the specified name
  'move_to'  : Move API attribute to the specified position
project-id handling in v2 API URL, and converts v2 response code.

Partially implements blueprint v2-on-v3-api

Change-Id: I71a805d5abd1d53fa7174c93cff5c11d0a58b2fc

commit_message:
Adjust audit logs to avoid negative mem/cpu info

we might have following audit info in the log:
AUDIT nova.compute.resource_tracker [-] Free ram (MB): -1559
AUDIT nova.compute.resource_tracker [-] Free disk (GB): 29
AUDIT nova.compute.resource_tracker [-] Free VCPUS: -3

which is really confusing to operater and useless
This patch adjust the log to print phy info and virtual cpus.

DocImpact

Change-Id: I2bc63e1aae0787bf976660eed8fd8899bfffe593
Closes-Bug: #1316916

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-07-30 18:35:19.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Provide a quick way to run flake8

"run_tests.sh -p" always checks every file for errors even though you
have probably only changed a handful. This patch adds "run_tests.sh -ph"
which only checks the files that were modified in the HEAD commit.

An unscientific benchmark shows that this is quite a bit faster:

Before:
$ time ./run_tests.sh -p
Running flake8 ...
./nova/compute/manager.py:77:1: F401 'periodic_task' imported but unused

real    0m37.493s
user    0m37.391s
sys     0m0.099s

After:
$ time ./run_tests.sh -ph
Running flake8 on nova/compute/manager.py
./nova/compute/manager.py:77:1: F401 'periodic_task' imported but unused

real    0m0.844s
user    0m0.818s
sys     0m0.038s

Change-Id: I8dafaab40fd0427719040a76c69a8ab05e9e4386

commit_message:
Provide a quick way to run flake8

"run_tests.sh -p" always checks every file for errors even though you
have probably only changed a handful. This patch adds "run_tests.sh -8"
which only checks the files that were modified in the HEAD commit or
the current working tree.

An unscientific benchmark shows that this can be quite a bit faster:

Before:
$ time ./run_tests.sh -p
Running flake8 ...
./nova/compute/manager.py:77:1: F401 'periodic_task' imported but unused

real    0m37.493s
user    0m37.391s
sys     0m0.099s

After:
$ time ./run_tests.sh -8
Running flake8 on nova/compute/manager.py
./nova/compute/manager.py:77:1: F401 'periodic_task' imported but unused

real    0m0.667s
user    0m0.624s
sys     0m0.036s

Change-Id: I8dafaab40fd0427719040a76c69a8ab05e9e4386

commit_message:
Fixing some issues in section_case-studies-database.xml

* improved some wording
* replaced "SSL" by "SSL/TLS"
* changed Postgres to PostgreSQL
* removed "self-signed" while using certificates

Closes-Bug: #1342912

Change-Id: I45753743c9a88990b2d087ffbbddea6be6d2ff63

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-07-24 12:32:29.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "libvirt: remove use of CONF.libvirt.virt_type in vif.py

The vif.py class imports the CONF.libvirt.virt_type parameter
from the main driver.py file. This sets up a circular dependency
which prevents driver.py importing vif.py in the top of the file,
since the CONF.libvirt.virt_type parameter won't have been
registered yet.

It is generally bad design practice to rely on global variables,
which is effectively what the CONF.* parameters are, so change
the VIF driver get_config() API to accept 'virt_type' as a
parameter instead.

Related-bug: #1302796
Change-Id: I023851df96640eeeb54124add8cc5c725b8d13be

commit_message:
libvirt: remove use of CONF.libvirt.virt_type in vif.py

The vif.py class imports the CONF.libvirt.virt_type parameter
from the main driver.py file. This sets up a circular dependency
which prevents driver.py importing vif.py in the top of the file,
since the CONF.libvirt.virt_type parameter won't have been
registered yet.

It is generally bad design practice to rely on global variables,
which is effectively what the CONF.* parameters are, so change
the VIF driver get_config() API to accept 'virt_type' as a
parameter instead.

Related-bug: #1302796
Change-Id: I023851df96640eeeb54124add8cc5c725b8d13be

commit_message:
Allow access to HTML final class string

The class_string property does NOT return the final class string.
This is evident in some of the BatchAction classes (which is a subclass).
The only way to get the final class string is through the get_final_attrs
method.

In order to retrieve the final class string, we would need to calculate
the final attributes. This can be cumbersome if all we want is the final
class string. This patch re-factored the code so that the final
class string can be retrieved independently.

Change-Id: I8f56ab407ac6426781cee4b531494d3ef2d41ea1
Closes-Bug: #1347071

Add ListOfDictOfNullableString field type

A new field type is added, it will be a list, with each item
in the list is a dict of string.

Implements: blueprint make-resource-tracker-use-objects

Change-Id: I4d3a310800afe344bc18c755658fc1dc3e792de8

commit_message:
Merge BadRequest tests of "create a keypair" API

In test_attach_interfaces, there are BadRequest tests of "create a keypair".
Most parts of them are duplicated.
This patch merges them for the readability and clarifying their purposes.

Change-Id: I784f5d05969aa9a0c85b63f064190ab4e92ed7f7

commit_message:
Change trove instance table name

To be consistent with other panels in
the dashboard we are renaming the trove
panels to use the term 'Instances'
instead of 'Databases' to represent the
top level Trove instance.

Change-Id: I30d2cfb82eeb7bf806dcf89e6a204a61a310f3ea
Closes-Bug: #1336492

name is also used in stdlib json documentation [1].

', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2014-08-08 15:26:48.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Fix the way of obtaining ceilometerclient

I0e027c33ee42b6de032d33269caeea33e7837f40 patch in ceilometerclient changed

To fix this problem and support backward compatibility we should use

commit_message:
Fix the way of obtaining ceilometerclient

I0e027c33ee42b6de032d33269caeea33e7837f40 patch in ceilometerclient changed
args of ceilometer clients objects, so we cannot transmit "endpoint" as
kwargs in newest version of ceilomerclient.

To fix this problem and support backward compatibility we should use
`ceilometerclient.client.get_client` instead of
`ceilometerclient.client.Client`.

Change-Id: Icdefef3e0bdbe0aeb5c817bb4af852eb36151b60

commit_message:
Migrate to oslo.utils

Replaces use of incubator's strutils and timeutils with the versions
from oslo.utils.  Also removes all of the now-obsolete incubator
modules from the tree and openstack-common.conf.

Change-Id: I4d277434c5b8af01e2b2326d56692c8dfb232c68

subject: Migrate to oslo.i18n
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2014-08-08 18:15:08.000000000', 'files': ['requirements.txt', 'tests/test_jsonutils.py', 'oslo/serialization/_i18n.py', 'oslo/serialization/jsonutils.py'], 'message': "Migrate to oslo.i18n

Converts jsonutils to use the oslo.i18n Message class.  Because that
isn't part of the i18n public API this requires importing a private
module of the class.

For the time being gettextutils is still left in the project
because strutils depends on it.  Once we switch to using strutils
from oslo.utils both can be removed.

Change-Id: Ie5aafc4b533331a669f5e53b0a65f7d86a9ca777
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Migrate to oslo.i18n

Converts jsonutils to use the oslo.i18n Message class.  Because that
isn't part of the i18n public API this requires importing a private
module of the class.

For the time being gettextutils is still left in the project
because strutils depends on it.  Once we switch to using strutils
from oslo.utils both can be removed.

Change-Id: Ie5aafc4b533331a669f5e53b0a65f7d86a9ca777

commit_message:
Don't validate parameters when listing stacks

The problem is stack-list will break if you end up with a stack that
has parameter validation issues.

The "issues" need to be fixed but also we need to make stack-list more
robust. This totally turns off parameter validation when "validate_parameters=False".

Partial-bug: #1321549
Change-Id: Ieed106772095e1ff5999523d769e3ed07503c84e

commit_message:
libvirt: remove 'vif_driver' config parameter

The 'vif_driver' config parameter was deprecated in the
previous cycle, so can be deleted now.

The two places in the test file which were overriding
the 'vif_driver' config parameter were redundant as
mocking already ensured the real VIF driver module
was not exercised.

The FakeVIFDriver class is thus no longer required, and
the FakeIptablesFirewallDriver class was already not
required, so both are deleted.

DocImpact
Related-bug: #1302796
Change-Id: I75519266ffc65df92efd20badfeaf88ac0d66f8a

commit_message:
Improve developer guide introduction

This patch adds more content to the developer guide index page,
including an expanded description of the project, its key
features, and the project's scope.

In addition, existing content was reformatted and edited for
readability.

Change-Id: Ie7cde809b574e190674e446abd3f3f70d7084170

commit_message:
Enable updating the status of a volume

Expose the functionality of the 'cinder reset-state' command in the UI.
As is the case with the 'cinder reset-state' command, this change
permits an operator to select any valid status, regardless of the
current status of the volume.

Implements: blueprint cinder-reset-volume-state
Change-Id: I45180e989fb535bfd1c5bc9123bf70e4b2e24f1b

commit_message:
Fix the error status code of duplicated agents

If posting the duplicated agent info to "create a agent" API, Nova v2
API returns a HTTP500 response(Internal Server Error).
The duplicated resources are not internal errors and this behavior has
been fixed on Nova v3 API. In this case, Nova v3 API returns a HTTP409
response(Conflict).
This patch fixes it for Nova v2 API.

Change-Id: I0b9424f9792270f6807cabcbf27a0f6e5ec42669

subject: Remove duplicated sahara-dashboard
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 841, 'name': 'Akihiro Motoki', 'email': 'amotoki@gmail.com', 'username': 'amotoki'}, {'_account_id': 6786, 'name': 'Sergey Lukjanov', 'email': 'me@slukjanov.name', 'username': 'slukjanov'}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2014-08-10 11:07:31.000000000', 'files': ['lib/sahara-dashboard', 'extras.d/70-sahara.sh', 'lib/sahara', 'stackrc'], 'message': 'Remove duplicated sahara-dashboard

Data Processing (Sahara) dashbaord codes have been merged into Horizon
and there is no need to setup sahara-dashboard now. Two Data Processing
dashboards (from horizon and sahara-dashboard) are confusing.

This commit also moves saharaclient codes to lib/sahara, and
defines sahara repositories in stackrc instead of lib/sahara
as other projects do.

commit_message:
Remove duplicated sahara-dashboard

Data Processing (Sahara) dashbaord codes have been merged into Horizon
and there is no need to setup sahara-dashboard now. Two Data Processing
dashboards (from horizon and sahara-dashboard) are confusing.

This commit also moves saharaclient codes to lib/sahara, and
defines sahara repositories in stackrc instead of lib/sahara
as other projects do.

Change-Id: I4be9ff7b784d8ca0333750fab57d49689b112afd

commit_message:
Remove ec2 contrib dependency on token_api

The ec2 contrib extension now utilizes the `validate_token` method
from the `token_provider_api` instead of directly referencing the
token persistence service.

This change is to ensure interactions with the token persistence
are consistent so that it is possible to support toggling
persistence of tokens.

Change-Id: Iad6c13d027fffdb23497f22b29a9ce6d5009f158
bp: non-persistent-tokens

commit_message:
Expose token revocation list via token_provider_api

Use the token_provider_api for the token revocation list instead
of directly accessing the token persistence service.

Tests have been updated to compare results from the token_api
and the token_provider_api for the revoked token list.

This change is to ensure interactions with the token persitence
are consistent so that it is possible to support toggling
persistence of tokens.

Change-Id: Ic3982329dd28db5b2f974fadbab6c5e010365d27
bp: non-persistent-tokens

commit_message:
Added ability to specify security group for node group

Extended API to support list of security groups in node groups and
node group templates. Changed db schema and provisioning engines (both direct
and heat) accordingly.

Partially implements: blueprint cluster-secgroups

Change-Id: I49d3551f6987552ff6398e8c87e22388f914f287

commit_message:
Ignore variable column widths in ovsdb functional tests

The ovsdb tests check the output of "ovsdb-client monitor" before and after
some operations. The first line of output is a header row with spaces for
column separation. The column widths can vary depending on the data in the
columns, so compress multiple spaces to one for testing.

Change-Id: I6b4690ea9ef1c1b215411ca2c39b1e65fec2c6c7
Partial-bug: #1336172
(cherry picked from commit 17686c1f24ddf1977bbd930ce94b3e3d76962c5b)

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-08-07 22:00:25.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Do not translate debug messages

LOG.debug messages do not need to be translated. The rdb driver
has a couple of debug messages that are translated. This patch
removes those debug translations.

Also, exception.ImageUnacceptable can contain non-ascii
characters. During development of additional unit tests, a
UnicodeError exception was thrown, pointing to the caught
ImageUnacceptable exception in _is_cloneable as the cause. This
patch fixes this by using six.text_type to properly translate
the exception.

Change-Id: I4ed36173f42b7bf487463f148ae94bd061f6bebb
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2014-08-08 02:05:49.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Do not translate debug messages

Also, logging exception.ImageUnacceptable can contain non-ascii

Change-Id: I4ed36173f42b7bf487463f148ae94bd061f6bebb
', 'number': 2}, {'created': '2014-08-08 03:12:17.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/drivers/rbd.py'], 'message': 'Do not translate debug messages

LOG.debug messages do not need to be translated. The rdb driver
has a couple of debug messages that are translated. This patch
removes those debug translations.

Also, logging exception.ImageUnacceptable can contain non-ascii

Change-Id: I4ed36173f42b7bf487463f148ae94bd061f6bebb
', 'number': 3}]
commit_message:
Do not translate debug messages

LOG.debug messages do not need to be translated. The rdb driver
has a couple of debug messages that are translated. This patch
removes those debug translations.

Also, logging exception.ImageUnacceptable can contain non-ascii
characters. This patch fixes this by using six.text_type to
properly translate the exception.

Change-Id: I4ed36173f42b7bf487463f148ae94bd061f6bebb

commit_message:
Add i18n to exceptions in serializer.py

A patch recently landed that removed the hard dependency on lxml. If
lxml is not install on the system, an error is thrown. This patch adds
internationalization to those messages.

Partial-Bug: 1351016
Change-Id: Ic3aba566b041b13935443294d2a5a91668285c2a

commit_message:
Add /nodes/detail support

This commit adds support for getting a list of node with all
attributes, to both the client and the shell CLI.

Closes-Bug: 1354051
Change-Id: Ic95b865b6e1da5fa42bb8fa7302bb4cd4c98d540

commit_message:
Remove duplicated check for router connect to external net

In the function get_assoc_data, we check the router which get
from _get_router_for_floatingip whether connect to external net,
but as it has already checked in _get_router_for_floatingip.

Change-Id: I0c00c480273145538d19569dc0a679e9935ad8f9
Closes-bug: #1353414

commit_message:
Network: interface attach and detach raised confusing exception

When the aforementioned operations failed they raised an exception
that was not coherent - this is due to the fact that the instance object
was passed to the exception. That would print the whole instance object
which is really confusing to a openstack user. The exceptions should has passed
the instance ID and not the instance.

TrivialFix

Change-Id: If3fa89b17210c1db3540cd813157b51e786e1494
Closes-bug: #1335076

commit_message:
Enable PEP8 checks E128, E251 and E265

* E128 continuation line under-indented for visual indent
* E251 unexpected spaces around keyword / parameter equals
* E265 block comment should start with '# '

Change-Id: Ie4b7d8a392c8e8bed58c171b5fc1b9db308036bc

[{'created': '2014-06-12 09:12:45.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Try and persist mac address for the bridge across reboots

We need to configure OVS to persist MAC addresses according to
this report from openvswitch: http://openvswitch.org/pipermail/discuss/2014-May/014058.html

For some reason this doesn't work. But I think we need to do something
similar so I am hoping somewhere will see this and tell me what I need to do.

Closes-bug: #1329238
Change-Id: I87302d468784a9c9d1703f485031016f87d57873
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2014-06-30 02:49:37.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Set the MAC address for ensure-bridge bridges

We're seeing the bridge sometimes not glue to the right port address. The
defined behaviour is to dynamically change the MAC based on attached ports
and as we need DHCP to work, we should set the MAC to the MAC that Neutron
expects.

Closes-bug: #1329238

commit_message:
Set the MAC address for ensure-bridge bridges

We're seeing the bridge sometimes not glue to the right port address.
The defined behaviour is to dynamically change the MAC based on
attached ports and as we need DHCP to work, we should set the MAC to
the MAC that Neutron expects.

Co-Authored-By: Michael Kerrin <michael.kerrin@hp.com>
Closes-bug: #1329238

commit_message:
Move to oslo.utils

`oslo.db` uses several modules(`importutils` and `timeutils`) from
`oslo-incubator`. This modules are already incubated and we should use them
from `oslo.utils`.

Change-Id: I09881ea3e115ca95bbd06ff5d1c0d5e253ed7640

commit_message:
docs - Fix docstring issues in virt tree

Fix the following errors in several files.

ERROR: Unexpected indentation.
ERROR: Unknown interpreted text role "paramref".
WARNING: Block quote ends without a blank line; unexpected unindent.
WARNING: Definition list ends without a blank line; unexpected unindent.
WARNING: Enumerated list ends without a blank line; unexpected unindent.
WARNING: Field list ends without a blank line; unexpected unindent.

Specifically the "Unknown interpreted text role" was fixed by adding
a separate import instead of importing 'text' directly. Others were
indentation, new lines, or adding lists.

Change-Id: I241ce1ca9831d9df00d022297ea622953a6fdc60

commit_message:
docs - Fix exception in docs generation

We need to pass the flavor_id when creating the side_effect
using FlavorNotFound exception

Change-Id: Id5d0ac387d2dca2dc70dabba173fc53972751236
Closes-Bug: #1351127

[{'created': '2014-07-28 22:40:59.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Pass CA certificate from env-var to overcloud heat -P parameter

In the devtest_overcloud.sh script, OVERCLOUD_SSL_CA_CERT

are already.)

', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2014-07-30 18:14:16.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Pass CA certificate from disk file to overcloud via heat param

to the overcloud via a heat parameter.

commit_message:
Pass CA cert from disk file to overcloud via cmd-line arg

The user can now specify a CA certificate file via a command-
line argument to devtest_overcloud.sh. Its contents will be
provided to the overcloud via a heat parameter.

commit_message:
Tidy base image by removing /var/log files

diskimage-builder/elements/base/cleanup.d/99-tidy-logs added
to tidy up (remove) initial logs files on disk images.

Makes for slightly smaller images, and easier times tracing post
boot issues.

Change-Id: Iee98b5d818e080bcd9635482bc29349a71938087

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2014-08-08 17:47:16.000000000', 'files': ['lib/nova_plugins/functions-libvirt', 'tools/build_qemu_libvirt.sh'], 'message': 'Support for libvirt/QEMU tar releases

Enable to install libvirt and QEMU from tar releases.
The definition of the variables LIBVIRT_VERSION and QEMU_VERSION
will result in the compilation and the installation of libvirt and
QEMU from the tar releases pointed in the variables.

local.conf example:
QEMU_VERSION=2.1.0
LIBVIRT_VERSION=1.2.7

Change-Id: I241bd6ef23ec8800993c173f594f5cc664d5db9d
Signed-off-by: Michele Paolino <m.paolino@virtualopensystems.com>
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Support for libvirt/QEMU tar releases

Enable to install libvirt and QEMU from tar releases.
The definition of the variables LIBVIRT_VERSION and QEMU_VERSION
will result in the compilation and the installation of libvirt and
QEMU from the tar releases pointed in the variables.

local.conf example:
QEMU_VERSION=2.1.0
LIBVIRT_VERSION=1.2.7

Change-Id: I241bd6ef23ec8800993c173f594f5cc664d5db9d
Signed-off-by: Michele Paolino <m.paolino@virtualopensystems.com>

commit_message:
Add API schema for v2.1/v3 config_drive extension

By defining the API schema, it is possible to separate the validation
code from the API method. The API method can be more simple.
In addition, a response of API validation error can be consistent for
the whole Nova API.

Partially implements blueprint v3-api-schema

Change-Id: Ia0681941c5449051c90425348466bd7dc44c2e45

commit_message:
Fixed cluster rollback on scaling with heat engine

We can't allow stack to move into Error state if we want to use it futher.
disable_rollback parameter controlls such behavior. It is Ok to have errored
stack for cluster create and rollback since we will not be using it anyway. But
for scaling we need to keep it Active since we can just rollback in case of
error.

Change-Id: Iab1a58f4924ca6a7689060f71217956a72316517
Closes-Bug: #1337006

subject: migrations: ensure predictable order of flavor creation
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 100, 'name': 'Johannes Erdfelt', 'email': 'johannes@erdfelt.com', 'username': 'johannes.erdfelt'}, {'_account_id': 1779, 'name': 'Daniel Berrange', 'email': 'berrange@redhat.com', 'username': 'berrange'}, {'_account_id': 1849, 'name': 'Joe Gordon', 'email': 'joe.gordon0@gmail.com', 'username': 'jogo'}, {'_account_id': 2750, 'name': 'Sean Dague', 'email': 'sean@dague.net', 'username': 'sdague'}, {'_account_id': 4393, 'name': 'Dan Smith', 'email': 'dms@danplanet.com', 'username': 'danms'}, {'_account_id': 5170, 'name': 'Microsoft Hyper-V CI', 'email': 'hyper-v_ci@microsoft.com', 'username': 'hyper-v-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 6681, 'name': 'Brent Eagles', 'email': 'beagles@redhat.com', 'username': 'beagles'}, {'_account_id': 9578, 'name': 'DB Datasets CI', 'email': 'turbo-hipster@lists.rcbops.com', 'username': 'turbo-hipster', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2014-07-30 11:11:07.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "migrations: ensure predictable order of flavor creation

The default flavors to be populated are stored in a dict
which means the order in which they are populated in the
DB depends on the python hash seed. With a default hash
seed of 0, this would result in a creation order of

  m1.medium
  m1.tiny
  m1.large
  m1.xlarge
  m1.small

but changing the hash seed would alter the order of
creation causing most of the libvirt driver tests to
fail because they'd get m1.xlarge instead of their
expected m1.small.

Change the default flavors to be recorded as a list so
that their creation order does not get affected by the
python hash seed. The flavours are re-ordered so that
the order of creation matches what was previously seen.
Note that in this order, the 'id' values in an otherwise
empty database would not match the 'flavorid' values
but this has been true since the migration was written.

Related-bug: #1350287
Change-Id: Ifd7eb471aed33dddbadca783112b74885cfeb1b5
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2014-07-30 12:05:19.000000000', 'files': ['nova/db/sqlalchemy/migrate_repo/versions/216_havana.py'], 'message': "migrations: ensure predictable order of flavor creation

The default flavors to be populated are stored in a dict
which means the order in which they are populated in the
DB depends on the python hash seed. With a default hash
seed of 0, this would result in a creation order of

  m1.medium
  m1.tiny
  m1.large
  m1.xlarge
  m1.small

but changing the hash seed would alter the order of
creation causing most of the libvirt driver tests to
fail because they'd get m1.xlarge instead of their
expected m1.small.

Change the default flavors to be recorded as a list so
that their creation order does not get affected by the
python hash seed. The flavours are re-ordered so that
the order of creation matches what was previously seen.
Note that in this order, the 'id' values in an otherwise
empty database would not match the 'flavorid' values
but this has been true since the migration was written.

Related-bug: #1350287
Change-Id: Ifd7eb471aed33dddbadca783112b74885cfeb1b5
", 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
migrations: ensure predictable order of flavor creation

The default flavors to be populated are stored in a dict
which means the order in which they are populated in the
DB depends on the python hash seed. With a default hash
seed of 0, this would result in a creation order of

  m1.medium
  m1.tiny
  m1.large
  m1.xlarge
  m1.small

but changing the hash seed would alter the order of
creation causing most of the libvirt driver tests to
fail because they'd get m1.xlarge instead of their
expected m1.small.

Change the default flavors to be recorded as a list so
that their creation order does not get affected by the
python hash seed. The flavours are re-ordered so that
the order of creation matches what was previously seen.
Note that in this order, the 'id' values in an otherwise
empty database would not match the 'flavorid' values
but this has been true since the migration was written.

Related-bug: #1350287
Change-Id: Ifd7eb471aed33dddbadca783112b74885cfeb1b5

commit_message:
Remove unused functions from policy enforcer

The policy.Enforcer class has two functions which we don't use
anywhere, and the check function is broken due to an argument
mismatch with _check, so remove them until such time as they
are actually needed.

Change-Id: I25199fffeed5905b0673f137c70720ddb6dc48cb

commit_message:
Fix attach interface shouldn't accept empty dict for V3 API

Currently attach interface API accept empty dict, then nova-compute
will try to search all the existed neutron network. But actually
it only accept one interface:
"https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/418398dcca552497c8488dbbf54a
06e21202b295/nova/compute/manager.py#L4521"

This should be fixed to refuse accept empty dict. And this is only
fix for v3 API. Because we can't change v2 API for back-compatibility.

Change-Id: Ia18ab1826cc3fd9de8b69d1af83ec81222c30c47
Closes-Bug: #1349226

commit_message:
Allow handlers to provide validation callables

In order to reject messages before they are processed
make it possible to provide a handler pair that will
validate the incoming message and either reject or allow
the message to be passed to the provided handler.

Part of blueprint wbe-message-validation

Change-Id: Ibd6ee40020c6b98283f40d5bd59e8950d63b7f71

commit_message:
add pre/post execute/retry callbacks to tasks

This enables us to execute code to set up or tear down
global state in running tasks.

Implements: blueprint task-callbacks

commit_message:
glance-api-paste.ini depends on osprofiler>=0.3.0

The argument hmac_keys is used, which was changed from hmac_key in 0.3.0. This
caused servers to not start if glance-api-paste.ini was parsed when the
installed version of osprofiler was lower than 0.3.0.

Change-Id: Ic0ce2badd4e1425e13634e82d1976370cde2708b
Closes-Bug: 1354509

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-07-21 15:26:55.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py', 'nova/tests/virt/libvirt/test_driver.py'], 'message': "libvirt: Avoid instance_dir failure in some storage configurations

During the pre_live_migration() call in libvirt, if is_shared_instance_path
and is_shared_block_storage are both False, we will fail with NameError
trying to reference the instance_dir variable. This patch just makes
us default to the utility method's notion of instance_dir, overriding
it in the special case of instance_relative_path being defined. The
associated test change ensures we always call get_instance_path() in the
normal case.

Change-Id: I6fc642b2ecc985d168bd67caa873c21ee552d942
Closes-bug: #1281295
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
libvirt: Avoid instance_dir failure in some storage configurations

During the pre_live_migration() call in libvirt, if is_shared_instance_path
and is_shared_block_storage are both False, we will fail with NameError
trying to reference the instance_dir variable. This patch just makes
us default to the utility method's notion of instance_dir, overriding
it in the special case of instance_relative_path being defined. The
associated test change ensures we always call get_instance_path() in the
normal case.

Change-Id: I6fc642b2ecc985d168bd67caa873c21ee552d942
Closes-bug: #1281295

Initial commit for the new engine

* Skeleton for the new engine
* Main modules and interfaces (Engine, WorkflowHandler, policies)
* Sketches of main engine methods
* Reverse workflow handler
* Function to check valid state transitions
* Unit tests

commit_message:
Add simple Swift resources

Works with HEAD and GET requests to obtain account, container, and
object details and metadata.
python -m examples.list openstack.object_store.v1.account.Account
python -m examples.head openstack.object_store.v1.account.Account

Additionally, there's an example called swift_list that lists containers
and then lists objects in the containers.

python -m examples.swift_list

Change-Id: If2d4526b095ae647f63b107f25652c223b0b1a17

subject: Fix multiple dispatch issue when using dispatch_on_drivername()
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 6849, 'name': 'Roman Podoliaka', 'email': 'roman.podoliaka@gmail.com', 'username': 'rpodolyaka'}, {'_account_id': 11816, 'name': 'mike_mp@zzzcomputing.com', 'email': 'mike_mp@zzzcomputing.com', 'username': 'zzzeek'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2014-08-10 22:25:01.000000000', 'files': ['tests/sqlalchemy/test_utils.py', 'oslo/db/sqlalchemy/utils.py'], 'message': 'Fix multiple dispatch issue when using dispatch_on_drivername()

The DialectFunctionDispatcher.dispatch_on_drivername() method
is a utility function that allows us to refer to a specific
database dispatch based on a string name.   Because it sends off
the database API name as "*", the dispatch system for multiple
dispatch was sending out a series of functions twice; this
patch repairs for that case.

Change-Id: I652b205d8d97136fb8279950ee33208ec0dcdf19
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fix multiple dispatch issue when using dispatch_on_drivername()

The DialectFunctionDispatcher.dispatch_on_drivername() method
is a utility function that allows us to refer to a specific
database dispatch based on a string name.   Because it sends off
the database API name as "*", the dispatch system for multiple
dispatch was sending out a series of functions twice; this
patch repairs for that case.

Change-Id: I652b205d8d97136fb8279950ee33208ec0dcdf19

Unit test test_different_sizes from RealFilePartitioningTestCase tests
26 variants of partitions sizes and applies each of them to a file,
therefore running time of this test more than 30s. This patch reduce

commit_message:
Reduce running time of test_different_sizes

Unit test test_different_sizes from RealFilePartitioningTestCase tests
26 variants of partitions sizes and applies each of them to a file,
therefore running time of this test more than 30s. This patch reduce
variants to some "typical", running time now about 5s.

Change-Id: I072666009f4ecca51e84a6dc71257d725aaf2f42

subject: Work around the issue with random PYTHONHASHSEED
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 8188, 'name': 'Ilya Sviridov', 'email': 'sviridov.ilya@gmail.com', 'username': 'isviridov'}, {'_account_id': 8601, 'name': 'Dmitriy Ukhlov', 'email': 'dukhlov@mirantis.com', 'username': 'dukhlov'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2014-08-08 08:52:42.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': 'Work around the issue with random PYTHONHASHSEED

New tox and python3.3 set a random PYTHONHASHSEED value by default,
affecting the way keys of dicts and sets are ordered, which breaks
unit tests when dicts/sets are compared. Until those comparisons are
fixed, we can work around this so that unit tests would pass for
people, who use the latest tox version.

Related-Bug: #1348818

Change-Id: I910824bcc440c84b924d9a30c423d1a2b8318a61
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Work around the issue with random PYTHONHASHSEED

New tox and python3.3 set a random PYTHONHASHSEED value by default,
affecting the way keys of dicts and sets are ordered, which breaks
unit tests when dicts/sets are compared. Until those comparisons are
fixed, we can work around this so that unit tests would pass for
people, who use the latest tox version.

Related-Bug: #1348818

[{'created': '2014-06-19 08:00:11.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Change Scheduler access to Aggregates

So as to fork the Scheduler code into a separate project, we need to
change the way the Scheduler accesses other Nova objects

This change is only focusing on aggregates.

Regarding accesses to aggregates table, the change can be divided in
three parts:
- modify ResourceTracker update_available_resource so that it provides
  scheduler a list of IDs of aggregates the host belongs to, as a JSON
  in extra resources.
- provide aggregates as part of the request_spec argument of
  select_destinations() when filtering from explicit aggregates or AZs.
- update scheduler filters so that it looks into HostState instead of
  aggregates and gets the associate metadata in request_spec.

Note: no other data except JSON will be changed in compute_nodes.

Co-Authored-By: Sylvain Bauza <sbauza@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Change Scheduler access to Aggregates

So as to fork the Scheduler code into a separate project, we need to
change the way the Scheduler accesses other Nova objects
This change is only focusing on aggregates.
Regarding accesses to aggregates table, the change can be divided in
two parts:
- Modify ResourceTracker update_available_resource so that it provides
  scheduler aggregates info the host belongs to, as a JSON in stats.
- Call update_available_resource im add/remove_aggregate_host() to update
  the host state if host is added or removed from an aggregate.

Note: no other data except JSON will be changed in compute_nodes.
Co-Authored-By: Sylvain Bauza <sbauza@redhat.com>

Change-Id: I8ef3397afd7470c9948b056445053692c178446e
Implements: blueprint isolate-scheduler-db

The openrc file that is downloaded from Horizon is missing the
OS_REGION_NAME setting. This causes issues in environments that have
multiple regions. If the Region is none, ensure that it is unset after

commit_message:
Add OS_REGION_NAME to openrc

The openrc file that is downloaded from Horizon is missing the
OS_REGION_NAME setting. This causes issues in environments that have
multiple regions. If the Region is none, ensure that it is unset after
sourcing the rc file to avoid and empty variable. This fix also cleans
up some language in the generated openrc file.

Change-Id: Ieab0b13afd79158c6bf603891164f01aff3aabf3
Closes-Bug: #1334791

commit_message:
Removes extra indents from TestSubresourcePlugin

Removed extra indents from in front of each function in the
TestSubresourcePlugin class in test_api_v2.py so that it
meets pep8 requirements and matches up with the rest of the code.

Change-Id: Id194514d47508f8915aca18347a3c404b91a7abd
Closes-Bug: 1355100

commit_message:
Add standard constants for CPU architectures

Introduce a nova/compute/arch.py module to serve a similar role
to nova/compute/vmmode.py, by providing constants for known
CPU architectures and validation/canonicalization APIs

Related-bug: #1348624
Change-Id: Idd4907b5488dd0832c15783d87d57d77ae654519

commit_message:
Fix test for stack delete on same active engine

The test was not starting the EngineListener, thus the engine_id was
None, so the corresponding code execution path was not actually
exercised.

Change-Id: If48ba9d3deb54f8e9ea1ed1987f832ddbaed33fc

commit_message:
Add required_contexts validator

Add a validator that checks if a benchmark scenario has defined in its
configuration file the context(s) that it requires to run first.

Example:
@validation.required_contexts("context1", "context2")
def benchmark_scenario():
  pass

Change-Id: Id83a6ff93acde2abbb29ec8351210e38d725ce48

[{'created': '2014-07-12 04:35:18.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Allow ResourceGroup to select an attribute path

Starting with the Juno version of HOT, ResourceGroup will take the path
into account when returning a list of attributes from get_attr. So
something like:

  {get_attr: [my_rsrc_group, networks, <network_name>, 0]}

will return a list of the first IP address of each server in the resource
group.

Closes-Bug: #1341048
Change-Id: I774dd14cd2e9ff878a214d5ea81faa6070bc48bf

commit_message:
Allow ResourceGroup to select an attribute path

Starting with the Juno version of HOT, ResourceGroup will take the path
into account when returning a list of attributes from get_attr. So
something like:

  {get_attr: [my_rsrc_group, networks, <network_name>, 0]}

will return a list of the first IP address of each server in the resource
group.

Closes-Bug: #1341048
Change-Id: I774dd14cd2e9ff878a214d5ea81faa6070bc48bf

commit_message:
VMware: Resize operation fails to change disk size

The finish_migration step will resize the cpu and memory to match
the new flavor chosen, but not the disk size. Additional code was
added to extend the disk size using ExtendVirtualDisk_Task.

DocImpact

Change-Id: Iff10443f603d329d01a74a620079f80518b75a50
Closes-bug: #1291741

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-07-29 20:02:13.000000000', 'files': ['global-requirements.txt'], 'message': "Don't use Django 1.4.0 nor 1.4.1

Versions 1.4.0 and 1.4.1 don't have the function `force_text` which
replaces `force_unicode`, Django>=1.4.2 running in Python3 doesn't
expose `force_unicode`.

Change-Id: If15427d0cba3fd762beefaa0e956edfda003774a
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Don't use Django 1.4.0 nor 1.4.1

Versions 1.4.0 and 1.4.1 don't have the function `force_text` which
replaces `force_unicode`, Django>=1.4.2 running in Python3 doesn't
expose `force_unicode`.

Change-Id: If15427d0cba3fd762beefaa0e956edfda003774a

commit_message:
Fix l3.filters and dhcp.filters file for tripleo installations

This change addresses a rootwrap filter issue specific to the l3-agent
and dhcp-agent in a tripleo deployment.  The location of the python
executable used in starting processes within a tripleo deployment
may be different than the /usr/bin/python location that is used
for the KillFilter in l3.filters and dhcp.filters.

Closes-Bug: #1272816

Change-Id: I4c78b074e298f49eae559c7ca451fa7f9fec5970

[{'created': '2014-07-18 06:21:28.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Add include_locations kwarg to nova.image.API.get()

To avoid feature envy from image backends that need image location URIs,
functionality of nova.image.glance._get_locations() is moved into
nova.image.glance.show() and exposed via a new include_locations kwarg
to the nova.image.API.get() method, which, when True, simply includes a
collection of location links when the image has them.

commit_message:
Add include_locations kwarg to nova.image.API.get()

To avoid feature envy from image backends that need image location URIs,
functionality of nova.image.glance._get_locations() is moved into
nova.image.glance.show() and exposed via a new include_locations kwarg
to the nova.image.API.get() method, which, when True, simply includes a
collection of location links when the image has them.

blueprint rbd-clone-image-handler
Co-Authored-By: Jay Pipes <jaypipes@gmail.com>

Change-Id: I5118013aa24f68520dee806c24265f2808a90588

commit_message:
Refactor serializer import to XmlBodyMiddleware

Previously, the keystone/middleware/core.py module would import
keystone/common/serializer.py regardless of the XmlBodyMiddleware class
being used. This change modifies keystone/common/serializer.py to raise
an error if there is an issue with using lxml at runtime.

Change-Id: I977275d0df8666b49ddbfadd4f5606d7c2292b1f
Closes-Bug: 1351016

commit_message:
Check for flavor creation added

What is done:
* default value for `flavor` variable returned by _create_flavor added
* checking for flavor for all dependent on it tests added
* change tested by manual syncing of code on master node

Change-Id: If8e2cba738169b1c19c37a2a7c545426ae7c9f16
Closes-Bug: #1349924

commit_message:
lost pycrypto requirement leads to ImportError

When porting oslo.config.generator to automatically generate trove
conf files, an ImportError happens
when trove.openstack.common.rpc.securemessage is imported as module.

Change-Id: I6ce715f3b8976812f391cdf5a7bc7616535489a6
Closes-Bug: #1353799
Related-Bug: #1234338

commit_message:
Add new multipath element

Provide an element that provides multipath support allowing a user to
configure multiple I/O paths to storage devices. Typically used with
SAN storage arrays.

Change-Id: I2f970399109b1396c25cb6e2ef2906310d04c5f8

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-04-28 20:01:23.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Add scenario test for load balancer's health monitor

This test checks load balancing with a health monitor.

The following is the scenario outline:
    1. Create two instances
    2. SSH to the instances and start two servers
    3. Create a load balancer with two members and with ROUND_ROBIN algorithm
    4. Create a health monitor and associate it with the created pool
    5. Check that the health monitor marked the members as ACTIVE
    6. Suspend one instance and make sure it's marked as INACTIVE
    7. Resume the suspended instance and check it's ACTIVE again

Add DeletableHealthMonitor class to tempest/api/network/common.py

Add _create_health_monitor and _associate_health_monitor_with_pool
methods to tempest/scenario/manager.py

bp lbaas-scenario-tests

Change-Id: I5f4df4ce20b7635fb020cd4fc81b0f96cfc383ab

commit_message:
Add scenario test for load balancer's health monitor

This test checks load balancing with a health monitor.

The following is the scenario outline:
    1. Create two instances
    2. SSH to the instances and start two servers
    3. Create a load balancer with two members and with ROUND_ROBIN algorithm
    4. Create a health monitor and associate it with the created pool
    5. Check that the health monitor marked the members as ACTIVE
    6. Check that both members answer requests
    7. Suspend one instance and make sure it's marked as INACTIVE
    8. Check that only the ACTIVE member answers requests
    9. Resume the suspended instance and check it's ACTIVE again
    10. Check that both members answer requests again.

Add DeletableHealthMonitor class to tempest/api/network/common.py

Change-Id: I5f4df4ce20b7635fb020cd4fc81b0f96cfc383ab

subject: Add scenario test for load balancer's session persistence

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-12-17 14:30:18.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Test load balancer session persistence

Test session persistence feature of load balancer.

The following is the scenario outline:
    1. Boot two instances
    2. Create a load balancer with two members, with ROUND_ROBIN
       algorithm and SOURCE_IP session persistence type.
    3. Send 10 requests to the floating ip, associated with the VIP,
       and make sure all the requests from the same ip
       are proceesed by the same member of the pool.
    4. Change session persistence type of the VIP to HTTP_COOKIE.
    5. Check that this session persistence type also forces all
       the requests containing the same cookie to hit the same
       member of the pool

commit_message:
Add scenario test for load balancer's session persistence

Test session persistence feature of load balancer.

The following is the scenario outline:
    1. Boot an instance
    2. Create a load balancer with two members, with ROUND_ROBIN
       algorithm and SOURCE_IP session persistence type.
    3. Send 10 requests to the floating ip, associated with the VIP,
       and make sure all the requests from the same ip
       are proceesed by the same member of the pool.
    4. Change session persistence type of the VIP to HTTP_COOKIE.
    5. Check that this session persistence type also forces all
       the requests containing the same cookie to hit the same
       member of the pool.
    6. Change session persistence type of the VIP to APP_COOKIE.
    7. Perform the same check.
    8. Turn session persistence off and check that the requests
       are again distributed according to the ROUND_ROBIN algorithm

Change-Id: I3bd6b42d9e07db797222aa654ac423b1a5aa49e1

commit_message:
add an ability to pass optional neutron parameters from CLI

- added parameters are required for production environments because they affect Neutron performance.
They allows to increase the number of api, rpc and metadata workers.

Change-Id: I68d08660120ad373b52a42e8bad650f805c6372b
Closes-bug: #1348149

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-01-27 10:31:06.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Add API schema for v3 security_groups extension

By defining the API schema, it is possible to separate the validation
code from the API method. The API method can be more simple.
In addition, a response of API validation error can be consistent for
the whole Nova API.

Partially implements blueprint nova-api-validation-fw

Change-Id: Ic240b877d8e7afeb32adf3dc3899a55396cf7210

commit_message:
Add API schema for v2.1/v3 security_groups extension

By defining the API schema, it is possible to separate the validation
code from the API method. The API method can be more simple.
In addition, a response of API validation error can be consistent for
the whole Nova API.

Partially implements blueprint v3-api-schema

Change-Id: Ic240b877d8e7afeb32adf3dc3899a55396cf7210

commit_message:
Migration to oslo.utils

Common code from sahara.openstack.common.db was replaced
by usage of oslo.utils library.
sahara/openstack/common/network_utils.py module was removed.
excutils.py, importutils.py, timeutils.py and importutils.py
modules are waiting for migration to oslo.utils in other
oslo-incubator modules and still exist.

Change-Id: I6a82a9dfdf704da16ed709c650fa68f9527fd668

commit_message:
Bootstrap 3 upgrade fixes for catalog index

Markup and CSS tweaks to resolve layout and button issues related to
Bootstrap 3 upgrade in Horizon master and make it more responsive

commit_message:
Remove a few more `lsb_release -is` calls

We update `lsb_release -is` calls to use the DTSTRO_NAME environment
variables provided by the operating-system elements.

Change-Id: I2a8a74ef486bb8cebf36a4080069b4414172a653

Remove a few more `lsb_release -is` calls

We update `lsb_release -is` calls to use the DTSTRO_NAME environment
variables provided by the operating-system elements.

commit_message:
Fixed issue with incorrect tearDown method

tearDown method will be called only if setUp method
was successfully executed before the test.
Need to perform some actions even setUp method doesn't
executed successfully and we need use addCleanup method:
 https://docs.python.org/2/library/unittest.html#unittest.TestCase.addCleanup

commit_message:
labs: install RabbitMQ message broker service

This changeset installs RabbitMQ on the controller node.

The password needed by OpenStack services to use rabbitmq can be sourced
from config/credentials.

Implements: blueprint openstack-training-labs
Change-Id: Ifff79e7d84b2f02c2bdded854721a6a73fa82465

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-07-09 20:04:35.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Network init order and keepalived fixes

These changes revise the boot order for network intialization such
that the configuration, VIP, HAProxy, and MySQL are available
and running prior to openstack-init starting.

These changes are necessary in order to prevent services in the boot
sequence from failing once the MySQL database URLs and bind-address
are changed.

With regards to keepalived, this commit includes a new script called
keepalived-status which determines the state of keepalived, and
returns 0 if keepalived appears to be in a healthy state.

Change-Id: Ia6f26305f8e744e4ff938dff85de1193183ecd8f
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2014-07-09 23:59:17.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Network init order and keepalived fixes

These changes revise the boot order for network intialization such
that the configuration, VIP, HAProxy, and MySQL are available
and running prior to openstack-init starting.

These changes are necessary in order to prevent services in the boot
sequence from failing once the MySQL database URLs and bind-address
are changed.

With regards to keepalived, this commit includes a new script called
keepalived-status which determines the state of keepalived, and
returns 0 if keepalived appears to be in a healthy state.

Change-Id: Ia6f26305f8e744e4ff938dff85de1193183ecd8f
', 'number': 2}, {'created': '2014-07-11 21:18:09.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Network init order and keepalived fixes

These changes revise the boot order for network intialization such
that the configuration, VIP, HAProxy, and MySQL are available
and running prior to openstack-init starting.

These changes are necessary in order to prevent services in the boot
sequence from failing once the MySQL database URLs and bind-address
are changed.

With regards to keepalived, this commit includes a new script called
keepalived-status which determines the state of keepalived, and
returns 0 if keepalived appears to be in a healthy state via status
files that keepalived has been configured to write out, and via
pinging any configured virtual_ips.

Service startup changes:

haproxy-nonlocal-bind in configure.d was moved from step 75 to step
21 to execute before haproxy was started so it could could perform
the non-local bind.

haproxy was moved from post-configure.d/ to configure.d/21-haproxy
to allow for HAProxy to bind to the VIP address that keepalived will
need to initalize and support passing connections to MySQL.

neutron-openvswitch-agent in configure.d was moved from starting at
step 80 to starting at step 21 as it creates the bridge interface
that keepalived utilizes, and thus is required for the vip to come
online.

keepalived was moved from from post-configure.d step 15 to
configure.d step 22 to allow the VIP to initailize to occur prior
to configure.d/53-init-openstack which is required for applications
to be configured to utilize the VIP address and HAProxy for MySQL
connectivity.  Additionally this script recieved a check to only
restart keepalived if it does not appear to be working, which may
be due to the state of the metadata being available to the instance
or just timing.

Service start-up addition:

configure.d/52-check-keepalived was added to abort the intialization
process instead of allowing 53-openstack-init to fail attempting to
access the database should keepalived or the vip not yet be ready.

Change-Id: Ia6f26305f8e744e4ff938dff85de1193183ecd8f

commit_message:
Network init order fixes for VIP

These changes revise the boot order for network intialization such
that the configuration, VIP, HAProxy, and MySQL are available
and running prior to openstack-init starting.

These changes are necessary in order to prevent services in the boot
sequence from failing once the MySQL database URLs and bind-address
are changed to utilize the VIP address.

Service startup changes:

haproxy-nonlocal-bind in configure.d was moved from step 75 to step
20 to execute before haproxy was started so it could could perform
the non-local bind.

haproxy was moved from post-configure.d/ to configure.d/21-haproxy
to allow for HAProxy to bind to the VIP address that keepalived will
need to initalize and support passing connections to MySQL.

neutron-openvswitch-agent in configure.d was moved from starting at
step 80 to starting at step 21 as it creates the bridge interface
that keepalived utilizes, and thus is required for the vip to come
online.

os-apply-config in configure.d was moved from 50 to 20 as the
configuration files must be written out for haproxy and keepalived
to function properly.

This change is depends on I29613bf314fd054d0c82492692d95de2303c64ae

Change-Id: Ia6f26305f8e744e4ff938dff85de1193183ecd8f

commit_message:
osnailyfacter changes for heat

* Add keystone_ec2_uri parameter to the openstack:heat section.
This changeset rewrites default values for heat::keystone_ec2_uri,
which points to localhost instead of controller_node_address.
* Remove RedHat OS check for openstack:heat.
Closes-Bug: 1352444

commit_message:
Fix sending parameter 'ceilometer' to openstack::cinder class

If role 'cinder' isn't exist in cluster, parameter 'ceilometer'
isn't sent in openstack:cinder class, and then cinder:ceilometer
manifest doesn't execute

Change-Id: Ib654853a5dae5344deabf9404f8972041c8bd157
Closes-bug: #1312631

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-07-15 18:42:50.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Adding keepalived restart check

This commit changes the keepalive script such that the presence of
address configuration is checked prior to taking any action as
keepalived is capable of running without address configuration in
addition to assuming a MASTER state.

The configuration has been also modified such that
/var/run/keepalived.operational is touched when keepalived is in
MASTER or BACKUP state.  The presence of that file will block the
post-configuration script from restarting keepalived as it can take
several seconds to initialize and if restarted every run can easily
result in undesirable looping during if CONTROLSCALE=1 and services
require the VIP address to be accessible to initalize.

These changes are in anticipation of changing the intialization
order to ensure that VIP initialization takes place before services
attempt to initialize.

Change-Id: I29613bf314fd054d0c82492692d95de2303c64ae
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2014-07-15 18:51:07.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Adding keepalived restart check

commit_message:
Keepalived reload check addition

This commit changes the keepalived script such that if keepalived is
already running, then it is sent a reload command instead of a
restart command.

Change-Id: I29613bf314fd054d0c82492692d95de2303c64ae
